I got the 'Colorful' selection, and it's exactly that...colorful!  I love lots of color, so this choice is perfect for me.  The colored stones are rather large, and the colors are very vivid.  There's a ring of round, bright turquoise stones on the inner edge,  then goldenrod yellow oval stones mixing it up with large fuschia rounds.  There are some clear rounds thrown in for extra sparkle, and a few metallic findings that enrich the overall look. This is a true collar-style necklace, and it fits me like an 18" necklace, and that's using the extender.  Because of the construction, you won't be able to add more than about another inch because it won't lay correctly if you do.  If you like longer necklaces then this piece probably isn't for you.  But if you love fun jewelry, if you like to be the star, if you want all that delicious color up by your face....come on in, the water is fine!  This would be a great piece to wear to a block party, casual day at the office, or just to go to the grocery store.  It would be pretty on a jewel neckline sweater, or in an open collar of a shirt.  It would also be a great gift for the little diva in your life.  At this price, it's no big deal if it gets lost or broken.  The only 'flaw' for me is the way the clasp is attached.  There is very little room between the end of the necklace and the lobsterclaw clasp, so it's awkward to get a good enough grip to open it and latch it onto the chain.  Because of that, this is a four star rating.  But, it's great for what it is...playful, colorful, inexpensive, and showy.  I'll be wearing this a lot come spring!
summary: It's like a box of crayons!

Based on the picture, this necklace has so much potential to be amazing, but it's just not quite right. This necklace is made by linking several segmented pieces together. Or at least most of it is linked with a few unlinked segments. Due to the unlinked segments, it doesn't lay flat on the neck without buckling. The metal looks a little overly "antiqued" in a few places. And a handful of the gems looks to be glued into place just a little off mark. Overall I suppose it's true that you get what you pay for, but in spite of that I had held out my hopes for this piece. I do not foresee myself wearing this out in public any time soon. Disappointing, because the cheerful combination of colors are really quite nice. Perhaps I can break apart the necklace and use the segments in one of my craft projects.
summary: An unfortunate case where you may want to scrap it and use it for parts

reviewText: The colors (teal and magenta) are exactly as depicted, and this is a very showy necklace set.  The metal is not a true black but more of a gun metal finish.  It has a rich, opulent effect, and it will absolutely get you noticed.  The stones are just glued onto the chain, so be very careful how you handle it.  I would also avoid extreme temps because that could break down the glue.  I took some black silk embroidery thread and "stitched" each piece onto the chain, tying it off in back.  It's pretty invisible, and at least if the glue fails, the thread should hold it into place until it can be reglued.  Each jeweled section is stitched independent of the others.  The earrings are post and clutch, and not very heavy.  They come with a disc-style clutch, so they sit properly in your ear.  The necklace has a lobster claw clasp, so it is easy to adjust.  The four star rating is because of the glue, otherwise it would have been five stars.  A fun, dramatic piece at a great price point.

I have a set of these forcefields in every one of my shoes. They work as advertised. Beware that sometimes, depending on the shoe, you will have to use a smaller size. I have a couple of Jordan's that need to use the small size because of lack of space. The tape on the forcefields holds very well to the inside of the shoe. However:  I received this suit on May 2nd.  As of today, July 2nd, I have worn it 18 times for a 1 hour water aerobics class 2 times/ week.  This is in an indoor saltwater pool, and I have not exposed this suit to sunlight at all.  It has been washed after each wearing with mild detergent in tap cold water and hung indoors in a windowless laundry room to dry.  It has completely deteriorated.  I don't believe it's fit to wear another time.  I have worn only the top, as I had a black and white swim trunk from another manufacturer that I liked with it.  It is still in perfect shape.

reviewText: Cute pattern, fits well and stays in place.

This bathing suit is perfect for a curvy girl who wants to be cool yet modest at the beach or pool. I'm a size 20-22 pants, but bought the 22 suit just to be safe. The bottoms fit nicely--not baggy, but not so tight it's inappropriate or uncomfortable. The top is a little baggy, but it still keeps the bust secure. There is a built-in bra--what you would find in a traditional spaghetti-strap tank--so it does keep your breast from getting pulled down or bouncing (gotta be real). The neck strap also helps with support, even though it is one size--meaning no adjustable buckle--but it fits nicely. The way the model is wearing the suit it exactly how it fit me, so the top comes down low enough to cover the mid-drift completely and meet the hip line. As for the color, the gray is a little darker than the photo, but the colors are so cute. I would recommend this suit for sure!

reviewText: Um, its a scarf. It keeps my neck warm, it looks cool. It's soft. Most of the other Kufiya on Amazon are made in China. Good globalization lets us support local businesses in developing countries, bad globalization just moves everything to the cheapest and most exploited labor pool. Don't do it...get this one. Ships directly from Israel.

This is a really nice product. You can wear it either as a scarf to keep your neck warm or in the traditional Arab kufiya style to stay warm, keep the sun off, keep dust out, etc.

I have only had it for a few weeks, but it seems well made and I think it will last as long as it's taken care of properly.

Promised shipping time is anywhere from a week to a month, presumably based on potential customs delays, but for me, it arrived about 7-10 days after it shipped, so it was faster than expected.

If I need another or a different color, I would definitely buy from Hirbawi.

Purchased these for my daughter. They are so stinkin' cute, my favorite Tom's so far! My only complaint is they don't carry them in my size 

I would say they're true to size for Tom's since they usually run a little big or even can "stretch" a tad after breaking them in. She is pushing Toddler size 9.5 and these are Toddler 9...as you can see from the pics, they have room to grow.

If you're like me and obsess for a ridiculous amount of time over the sizing....and if your child is in that awkward in-between-sizes phase, I would say you could really go either direction with sizing in Tom's.

Even though the size we got has room to grow, we've gotten Tom's in the past a size up and though they did have a lot more room she was still able to wear them (without socks).

In fact they've always been her favorite so she wore them all the time, ran, played, walked long distances....all without complaining of her feet hurting and never blistering. The ones that we ordered a size up in lasted a LONG time.

So long story short, their sizing works great that If you go with their current size, or a bit smaller, they most likely will fit great...and possibly with room to grow!

Last thing about these shoes, the pictures really don't do justice of how cute they are. They also have some silver threading that gives a little shimmer effect when it catches the light...nothing dramatic but a nice touch In the second picture I posted you can see it a little better

I bought these for myself, as I fit into youth size shoes. Girl's 5 are about a women's 7. The fit of youth TOMS are a little different from the women's, but I happen to prefer the youth. They are a little boxier in the front. I love the colors of these TOMS. Funky and cool.

reviewText:
This review comes 10 months after purchase, and while that seems like it might be a long time, I'm pretty particular about rotating through my underwear supply to keep from wearing anything out too quickly from repeated washing.  As such, these have been through probably 30 washes, worn for up to 15 hours each time.  Given the $29 price tag, I expect quality and durability.

The fit on these is very nice, and they're very, very comfortable.  The legs don't ride up a lot, although the waistband may bunch up throughout the day.  The fabric has pilled a bit.  If it wasn't for the quality control issue with the mesh panels and seams with this pair, they'd be almost perfect.

After an estimated 30 wash&wear cycles, the mesh panels on either side of the guy bits are showing some pretty remarkable deterioration, compared to another pear of the same age.  The threads along the seams are starting to unravel, and many places on the mesh panels are now missing threads, looking like a runner in pantyhose.

Will I buy the brand again?  Likely.  Definitely not this pattern though.
summary: Fits nicely, comfortable, but some quality issues

Before I write this, I want to talk about how much I hate underwear. Passionately. Despise it. In fact, I've just avoided it completely since I was old enough to buy my own clothing when I moved out of my parents house. I've tried various brands. Various styles. Boxers. Boxer briefs. Briefs. You name it. I just hate it all. The reasons are numerous but irrelevant.

I was coerced into trying a pair of these by a client of mine who sells them. He told me oh you just have to try them just try them I'm like ugh no I don't care how innovative they feel or look or ovepriced they appear to be. He had a Realtree pair in stock, and I said ok, I love Realtree so worst case I'll just have something else.

I've been wearing this for a week now. I have worn them every day this week (yes, I've been washing them each night) because I am absolutely in love. In fact, yesterday I went back to my client's store and sheepishly admitted I wanted two more pairs. We laughed about it for awhile but I walked out a happy man.

I really can't describe the level of innovation that these thing possess. They don't ride up, they are basically like wearing nothing at all. There are times when I forget I even have any equipment there. It's indescribably comfortable. I've even worn them to bed every night. Even with jeans on, they're comfortable as anything I have ever experienced. No more frank n beans sticking to things. No more discomfort or furniture rearranging when moving around.

I'm curious how they last from a longevity standpoint. Viscose and spandex tend to be prone to pilling after awhile, and spandex is prone to breaking down over time and losing its elasticity. For $30, I expect a lot of life out of them - but that remains to be seen. So far, I'm beyond happy. For sizing, I'm a 33" waist, 5'11", and 195 lbs. I wear a size medium with no issue - so the size chart appears to be relatively accurate. They looked pretty tiny when I opened the package, but they fit fine. I have heard from the store personnel where I bought them to go up a size, but I stayed true to the size chart.

SAXX are favorite underwear.

I buy my SAXX a size down. I have a pair of Fiestas, two Platinum, two Kinetic briefs, a pro elite, and a vibe. I like the junk-holding mesh stuff, it's kinda nice. Here's a breakdown of my opinions on them all in the order that I bought them:

Vibe: They have the most style options. If you want to be looking fresh in your skivvies when you're getting down with the gal/guy of your choice, these ones are probably going to get you the most style points. HOWEVER, they are shorter than he rest, and maybe it's just my legs, but they ride up the most, so I won't be buying more.

Fiesta: These ones are cotton, so if that's what you dig, get em. However, the cotten will stretch out throughout the day, so you won't get that awesome 'tight' feeling after a few hours of wearing them. They may ride up a little, but nowhere near as much as the Vibes.

Pro Elite: I think these are my favorite. I mow grass and go to the gym a lot, so I appreciate the dry-fit-esque fabric down there when my fun bits start sweating. They won't stretch out throughout the day like the Fiestas, and they won't ride up like the Vibes.

Kinetic: I bought two pairs in a medium and am now thinking they should have been Large. More on that if I ever buy a large pair. Since they're briefs, riding up isn't even possible. they're by far the most breathable, and the first pair on my list to have a penis hole for when you're wearing dress pants and want to pee without untucking your shirt and fiddling with a belt and all that jazz. If I know it's going to be hot, I wear these to stave off the ever-threatening swamp nuts.

Platinum: If you want to wear the softest pair of underwear that have ever touched your body, and you want whoever touches you to feel the softest pair of underwear of their life, then these are the ones you want. I'm not sure if they make these out of kitten fur or what, but when I wear these I'm confident that my underwear is softer than every other man I pass that day, so if that's what you're going for, these are for you. BONUS: these ones also have a penis hole which is convenient.

Overall I'd say... Pro Elite/Kinetic > Platinum > Fiesta > Vibe, but maybe that's just me. In the future I won't be buying more vibes, I'm unlikely to buy more Fiestas, I'm somewhat-likely to buy more Platinums, and I'm very-likely to buy more Pro Elite/Kinetics.
summary: I like the junk-holding mesh stuff

My review of all the Saxx I now own

Vibe - Super comfy and what I now consider my standard wear.  Fit as expected.

Fiesta - Also super comfy.  More of a cotton feel. Fit well, ride up a bit but they better than vibe when the weather is a little cooler

Platinum - This material is so nice it feels like silk.  These are not modern fit so I wish I had a size smaller.  It's not a matter of waist size but rather how low the "pouch" is.

Ultra - Basically the same as the Platinum

Kinetic Brief - Tighter fit but really keeps everything in place.  Breathable

Kinetic Boxer - These are the perfect workout underwear.  Very breathable.  Legs stay down. Totally worth it.

Quest - These are very low riders and sit well below your waist line but are still very snug.  Interesting material that dries very fast.  Probably could have sized up a size on these but now I wear them under my swim trucks because they dry super fast.

Ultra Brief - The most comfortable brief I've ever word.  Very stretchy so they are always comfortable.  Tight wear they need to be but plenty of room for everything that needs room.

Overall, I've really liked my change over to Saxx.  They are pricy but you can normally find off colors for about 30% off if you look around amazon so try that for the first kind you want to try.

reviewText: Again, needs to be returned. Complaint from husband that there is no frontal opening

Bought these for my husband for christmas. He tried them on and threw them in the washer, and they came out with the waistband already ripped and coming apart. These are way too expensive for that. I don't know if I just got a defective pair, but it was extremely disappointing.

First day he wore them he was like "these are nice!"... a day later was asking when we would get some more! No more 'sticky balls' or the 'grab n shake' adjust move, or stand up n have a spontaneous urge to do the stanky leg before walking....his life has been transformed!... and Yes, he now has a few more colors n styles!

Great fabric, effective innovative pouch design giving you plenty of support, but too many sizing & fabric care issues for the price when there are cheaper better options.

#1 On a size medium, laid out flat, the waistband measures only 13" across even after the waistband is pulled snug against a flat ruler, that means 26" around.  Not a misprint or fluke as I was gifted a dozen pair and they all measure the same.  Being elastic it shouldn't be a problem and the waistband does stretch, but not as much as you'd think - there's something tight about SAXX elastic that makes is restrictive..  As a result, while I can easily get them on my size 33" (GAP/BananaRep jeans & BrooksBrosGabardine) pants wearing waist (yes it's flat), while they feel comfortable for a while, eventually the waistband starts to roll over on itself in half, feeling more like a tight cord.  If I take my vanity out of caring about printed sizing, the waistband on a size XL measures 15" across or 30" around.  Waistband is more comfortable but now the brief has so much more fabric, requiring to pull up the briefs higher to get the proper lower crotch support, ending with the waist riding up almost below my ribs.  And yes I do have developed legs & a muscular butt so I'm not lacking in any body portions that normally fill out a pair of briefs, back or front.  Perfect design for a medium would be a XL waistband on a size medium fabric brief.

#2 Fabric is (95%) Viscose, basically a version of rayon.  Very light & thin, it if were made in white almost sheer, pouch design itself is supportive.  Pros: your junk stays where it's suppose to, no sweating or heat even tho it's a manmade fabric, feels like you're going commando yet still supported, if it weren't for the overly tight waistband. Cons:  vicose/rayon can't take a lot of heat.  So as other reviewers have stated, they'll eventually melt & rip if you weekly throw them in the dryer with the rest of your cotton laundry.

Personal preference is Jockey's Microfiber Performance Boxer Brief (item # 8050):
- 1/2 the price
- 95% microfiber polyester (vs vicose) less susceptible to heat in dryer AND fabric itself is more supportive of your junk rather than requiring innovative sewn-in sling support
- more proportionate sized waistband which stretches more & fabric itself more supportive, less shear, and .... like SAXX no sweating cuz you think it's a man made fabric.

Underwear for guys should not be this complicated, but with SAXX charging $30+ per pair, it has.  I just want to buy 12 pairs, not pick-n-choose what I grab out of the drawer every day, and know they'll last a year.  Jockey #8050 is a better 1/2 price option.  My 2 cents.......
summary: too many sizing issues for the $$$$

reviewText: Best ever

This review has been a long time in the works. Ive had several years' experience with a few different styles of Saxx - Pro Elite, Vibe, and Fiesta. They are truly life changing underwear. I hand wash all my Saxx because I want them to last forever. For reference, Im 58 150 lbs, 31" waist, and almost always wear size small in other underwear (CK, Champion, etc).

PRO ELITE
Amazing. I think these are the best all-purpose Saxx. As with all Saxx, the mesh panels work perfectly - brilliant invention. Ive searched far and wide for boxer briefs that are the right length to prevent chafing. 9 inseams (Champion, UA) prevent the thigh rubbing, but I find that the longer length rides *down* my legs instead of up, which pulls the material away from my junk, loses support, and leads to ball/thigh rubbing. Some 6 inseams still ride up because I like to hike them up a little to begin with to prevent ball chafing. Saxx to the rescue! These sit very naturally in the middle of the thigh and eliminate all chafing for me. Regular walking NEVER causes these to ride up. Ive worn these under jeans and shorts and they always stay in place. If you're doing lots of climbing or sitting Indian style they will probably ride up, but so would everything.

The polyester material stays super dry. They also smell WAY less than all the other polyester underwear Ive ever worn. These never seem to get that awful poly stink. Huge plus. These are perfect for casual hiking, great in the cold weather and also when its hot to keep you dry. They should last a long time.

Note: the Pro Elites definitely run big! Size down, especially if you're in between sizes. I wear an XS in these. I tried the smalls and the mesh panels were too loose to provide consistent separation down there (especially when more active) and didn't give much support. When I tried the XS everything was perfect. The only downside of sizing down to the XS is that the waistband is pretty tight.

VIBE
These are suuuuper comfortable, and also look great. Theyre modern fit and seem to run more true to size - I wear a small.

But the Vibes have a huge drawback. Without fail, the material loses its shape well within an hour. They will start to ride up and will not stop. It will only get worse as time goes on, especially if you're hot or sweating. I cant wear these for any kind of outdoor activity beyond a short walk with the dog. Losing their stretch will also lead to wedgies. By the end of the day, they're so loose that the mesh panels are no longer stretched sufficiently to stay in place. But if you don't care about these things these things, these might be your jam.

For me, the Vibes are perfect for around the house, lounging in pajamas, and even sleep. I wear them every night. They also show off your goods rather nicely. The viscose (modal) is very soft and feels amazing against your skin. I never want to take them off like I do synthetic underwear. They do fine in the washer, but I hang dry them because the dryer will cause the elastic waistband to wear out prematurely.

FIESTA
Also amazing. Great for casual and everyday use. The mesh panels work perfectly and keep everything separated. The newer anti-roll striped waistband is a huge improvement. It feels very comfortable against my skin and does not roll. I haven't done anything super active in them, but for casual wear they barely/rarely stretch out or ride up. They stay drier than 100% cotton. Theyre maybe a half inch longer than the Pro Elites and provide plenty of chafing protection.

The Fiestas also run big. I wear an XS and they fit perfectly. Ive also noticed some inconsistencies in the Fiestas. They can vary slightly in length, rise, inseam, and mesh panels. Nothing major. I haven't had any of the 24/7s but they are the same material as the Fiestas.

Other good places to buy Saxx are eBay, Backcountry, and Classic Shapewear. I personally have no problem spending $25-30 a pair because good fitting underwear is very important to me. Hopefully this helps and doesnt make anyone more neurotic about underwearnot that Id know what thats like.
summary: The comfiest Saxx with a huge drawback.

reviewText: I had been searching for years for bamboo yoga pants that weren't $90-100 a pair. I have a brand I love but each pair costs me so much I had to find an alternative for my active summer job; I get to wear yoga pants everyday and $100 a pair was too steep.  I finally found these and thought for the price, I will give them a try. So far they have kept their color after washing, they are softer than cotton yoga pants and hold up better than any other cotton brand I have purchased on Amazon or in stores for a similar price. As for fit, I am 5'7" and usually buy size large pants, I bought the XL to insure I had extra length because I like them a little long.  It worked and they are a little long on me, they are tight around my butt but a there is a little extra material around my thighs but that's okay.  I prefer tighter but I will trade it for the longer length.  The stitching wasn't the best as one reviewer mentioned but they haven't come undone or anything. I heard a rip when I did my first few yoga moves in them but it doesn't seem to have compromised the pants yet.  If they start to unravel I will be sure to update this review.  I have purchased 3 pairs so far and really love them for the price. I would recommend these to anyone who loves bamboo yoga pants but doesn't want to pay the normal $100 price tag. They aren't as great as my favorite brand but well worth it for the savings.  I am surprised more people haven't caught on to these yet.
summary: Great bamboo yoga pants for the price!

The price is also great - about a third of any of the other yoga pants made with bamboo fiber that I found after searching extensively online. If you haven't tried bamboo yet, it's an amazing fiber, softer than merino wool, more absorbent and more durable. It's also antibacterial so odors don't build up (not quite as odor-resistant as the wool, but almost). I would recommend these to anyone! I ended up buying 2 more pairs after my initial purchase!

reviewText: 2 sizes to small Plus there was a black mark across the bottom front

I should have learned by now not to purchase anything that is being shipped from China, Thiland, Korea or any other countries from the orient since their sizes are so off from American sizes.  I usually wear size 12 or Large.  This top that I couldn't wait to receive, I ordered in size XXL per the measurements and the conversion chart to American sizes.  this blouse could not go over my head and shoulders.  I would say that their size XXL is no larger than American size small, or at the most size Medium.  This has happened to me again and again, buying clothing that is so way off in their sizing that I ended up keeping the clothing because it costs too much to ship it back, but something that I can never wear and end up donating them.  What a shame that they cannot get the sizing right for American customers.  So,  this is it, never again will I purchase something from Asian countries.  Lesson learned the hard way
summary: Incorrect sizing from Asian made clothing

reviewText: I loved the photograph of this blouse, so I ordered it.  I normally wear between a ladies size medium and large. Because they seemed to be shipped from overseas, I didn't try to return either one; I have daughters that wear size 0 and size 4 that they will fit. Just know that these sizes are NOT the same as American sizes. I give it two stars because the workmanship and quality are good, but the sizing is terrible. reviewText:
Fit is great- these are crazy comfy, and you can barely feel it even if there is pressure on your ear. Got these because I've had trouble sleeping on infinity ring style ones in the past, and haven't had any issues with these ones at all. Sure they were a little tricky to get on- didn't have trouble with snapping the ball into place, but the opening is very small and difficult to slip over your ear (especially if your cartilage piercing isn't right up against the helix)... But the trade off of a few seconds of discomfort to get it in is totally worth how great these feel and look once they're on properly.

PROTIP: don't listen to the reviews saying you need to bend the hoops to get them on- only reason the ball stays in place so well on a captive bead is because of the tension when you snap it in place... because you know, science.
summary: Look great, Feel great, Love these!

reviewText:
Overall, I absolutely love it.

1. I can sleep with it in at night and it usually doesn't bother me.
2. I can wear it while I go swimming.
3. There are no rusts or changes in color. I wear it in the shower and the pool and have had it for 1 month +.
4. It's kind of hard to get them in at first, but the longer you use them the easier they let the bead in.
5. I don't have a second cartilage piercing, so I use one of them and keep the other one as a backup in case I lose the first one.
6. They let my cartilage heal faster and they don't stick into the back of my head when I lay down like a stud would.

Now I'm not saying that you can do tons of cannonballs into a pool without them falling out (I haven't tried that in fear of losing them), but they do stay in really well and are really high quality. I wouldn't trade them for any other one.

reviewText: Light weight

I used to use whipped silicone breast forms (bilateral mastectomy 12 years ago) but my sets always leaked after a year or two and were way too expensive to replace after a while. I also developed heat rashes where the forms sat against my skin and dents in my shoulders from the weight of the forms. I finally broke down and purchased a set of these foam forms and they are amazing. You need to make sure that you have a good fitting bra because you won't have any weight to hold these in place. Thses forms are easy to clean and hold up really well with weekly washings. I toss them in a lingerie bag and wash with my regular laundry then hang them to dry using clothespins and a hanger. I recently purchased a second set just to have on hand but my first set is holding up well after six months. I highly recommend these forms.
summary: Replaced my whipped silicone forms with these

Light and good shape
Perfect fit! Exactly what I was looking for. Theyre lightweight and exactly the size I needed and to my surprise is that I could wear them for swimming as well. Love them!

I highly recommend these forms for bilateral mastectomy patients! I ordered them because I wanted forms before the expensive (insurance covered) mastectomy bras and gel forms were available. I started wearing these about one month after surgery. I put them in a comfortable, stretchy, pull over bra that came with thin foam inserts (i.e. the Coobie bra). The bra has slits to remove the thin inserts. I can easily stuff these forms through the slits. The forms come with sticky strips, but they are not necessary with this type of bra. They hold their shape in soft bras unlike gel forms. They are very light and comfortable; I may never wear my gel forms. I am so happy with them that I ordered a second set so they can air dry after washing.

The size chart on the package (pictured in the product photos) seems accurate. I was a size 36B which equates to a size 5 form. I ordered size 4 forms because I wanted them a little smaller, and they are the right size for me. Note that this item is only one form; you must order two to have a set.

Some people mentioned an odor. I noticed a slight foam smell for about 2 days after I removed them from the packaging. If you are sensitive to odors, plan to air them out for a few days.
summary: Highly Recommended for Bilateral Mastectomy Patients

reviewText: Lightweight, comfortable, and it gives a natural, feminine profile.  It can slip around inside a sports bra or swimsuit, but the adhesive strips hold it in place. I wish my doctors had recommended this product to me.

What can I say, it's a great wallet. I love the simple, yet effective design. I had the original Crabby Wallet and was very happy with it. It began to wear from normal use and decided to try out this new and improved version.

It's not a drastically different product, but the few minor tweaks are a huge improvement. I love the new band design, as it makes it much easier to insert and remove cards. The rubber grip on the inside of the band works very well at securing the band in place. The metal eyelet that replaced the elastic was a nice touch too, as my elastic eyelet was about to separate from the wallet.

Overall I've very pleased with the Crabby Wallet. I keep my wallet in my front pocket and it does a great job of eliminating the bulk of a traditional wallet. For the price you can't go wrong.
Love the design. Very convenient and will hold a surprising amount of cards for being a small minimalist wallet. Everyone who sees mine, wants one of their own.

reviewText:
very easy to use, and having the keys attached simplifies my life a lot (as someone who always misplaces things)

doesn't ever fall out like leather/faux leather wallets.

You can fit 5-6 cards easily with enough room for some folded cash
You can use a plastic sandwich bag and a heavy rubber band and get the same result.

I switched from a traditional money clip to this.  So far so good, the construction seems solid and the elastic band still has stretch to it so it's secure holding my cards.  The wallet fits about 10 cards but can only hold a few bills folded in thirds.  My only issues is the key loop fell off in the first week and I didn't notice, luckily I did not have a key attached.

I had my first Crabby Wallet for about 5 years. After about a year or 2, the original wallet started to become slightly loose.  After about 4 years it stopped holding things. While I wish the thing lasted longer, I found that I liked the format very much. I looked for something else, but I could not find something as good. The reason I went with this wallet is that I wanted a front-pocket wallet that would not be bulky. This wallet really excels as a front pocket wallet.  I just want to carry a few things around with me, and this allows me to do that.

The wallet is, essentially, an elastic pocket. The whole thing stretches. When new, it holds the cards very securely; so much so the top strap is not even necessary when new. The key loop is pretty useless. It was pretty awkward with most keys; Too bad.

Some things have changed since the original. 1) the strap over the top is available in colors other than red. There is some anti-slip stuff on the back of the strap over the top. 3) the loop to key loop is secured differently. The old loop was just a thick piece of cord. Overall, the changes are improvements.
summary: First one lasted a few years, hopefully the second lasts longer. Excellent format.

reviewText: I used to always have a crazy think wallet and it seemed to be causing me hip problems. I wasn't sure if I could transition to a minimalist wallet but I was motivated to try. I was able to make some good choices and get everything I needed into this wallet and it's way more convenient and comfortable than what I used before.
I love this wallet.

As a bonus there is a very strong loop that you can attach somewhere on your torso piercing just in case your limbs are missing when rescuers arrive!

reviewText: This is my 3rd Crabby wallet. I bought two version one's from Kickstarter. Version 2 is better than the 1st. Reinforced card strap and it feels like better material. Now that I've had these wallets, I couldn't even think about going back to a normal wallet. I don't care for a keyring, I removed it immediately. I don't like carrying cash as I think it's archaic. This wallet forces me to carry only the essentials. Some people will hate the idea of the top of the cards (or bottom depending on how you insert them) sticking out the top of the wallet. I love it. It males it easier to fan thru them, finding the exact card you need. My next purhase will most like be the L3 Crabby Wallet (leather). If you are looking for a minimalist wallet, this is for you! Seriously, nothing thinner or easier to use. My high recommendations!
been using it for over a year and still going perfectly... I love it!
summary: very sturdy, it's holding 100% after 1 year

reviewText: I really love it, it works as I expected. this is my favorite wallet

reviewText: Came quick and i like the product

Bob Mackie is a crabby dude, so Bob Mackie needed a crabby wallet. Bob Mackie tends to get real drunk and his wallet falls out of his pants. Hell, lots of things fall out of his pants. But Bob Mackie loves this wallet, because it fits snuggly inside his pocket. The fabric exterior is not only soft, but allows the wallet to not slip and slide. Although you don't need to use the litte strap, it's helpful. And since Bob Mackie is no baller, he doesn't need space for more than 3-4 cards and a few small bills. Bob Mackie still has crabs though.

reviewText: Love it. I've used a different brand with no strap for a couple years. This strap and key ring are welcome upgrades. The strap is much more convenient for cash that the middle slot on my old front pocket wallet. The key ring/tether is great for attaching my tile. If youve never had a front pocket wallet, you need to try. If you are already a convert, this is likely a better model than what you already have.

reviewText:
I loved it since I found out!
My wife made me buy her one!
My friends all bought one!
Last a minimum of three years!

Much smaller than my old wallet, even when it's mostly empty and this one is full. Cards don't seem any harder to get in an out. I've got 7 cards (2 embossed), a few bills, a folded up check and an insurance card in it.
Awesome - so much more freedom from my bulky old wallet!

I got one of these on kickstarter years ago. I still use that one today. I wanted a different color and the other was was getting worn out. I was surprised amazon could get these so I ordered a blue one.  After one (1) week of use, the stitching on the bottom started to unravel. I cut it off, and went on with life, then the next week, another length of stitching came loose and I had to cut that off also.  So far the cards still stay in place thanks to the double row of stitching, but I do not see this "new improved" version lasting as long as the original.
summary: Not as good as the original.

reviewText:
Just got my Crabby Wallet today and I love it. It's super small and not only carries everything I need, but forces me to only carry what I need. It's like not having a wallet at all, but still having everything I need secured in my pocket, and that's fantastic.

Not sure how it will hold up in the long run, but I'm so pleased with how compact it is, how nice it looks, and how cheap it is, that I may buy a few more and store them away just so I know I have a backup in case something happens to it.

I've been using this for about a week. I like it, but there are definitely some compromises to be made when switching to a minimalist wallet.

I can't imagine trying to shove 10 cards in this thing. I have four and some cash and it's REALLY tight.

I like the keychain loop on the side of the wallet. It was one of the main reasons why I picked this wallet over other minimalist wallets. Unfortunately, having more than a key and maybe one or two loyalty cards on the strap means that it doesn't stay tucked under the perpendicular strap--which means that it gets caught in my pockets more often than not. I'm willing to go with fewer loyalty cards, but I want to have them handy, and we're back to my initial point--having a bunch of cards in this wallet just doesn't seem feasible.

Also, I miss the ability to have a few coins handy.

I'll use this until it falls apart, then keep looking for the perfect wallet (for me)...
summary: I like it, but there are definitely some compromises to ...

reviewText: I'm a huge fan of this wallet. Great price, doesn't take up as much space in my pocket, lasts a surprisingly long time. I was afraid it would fall apart in a few days or lose elasticity but it's held up well. Even if mine broke right now I would immediately buy another one.
Simple and awesome

I was looking for a smaller wallet alternative. And this has been great. Can fit quite a bit and still be small enough. And holds money with the band well, too. Has rubberized coating inside band to help retain cash
Awesome slim wallet. Exactly what I expected. Highly recommend.
Beware of the quality of this wallet. It will start unraveling at the top. The elastic thread will come apart.
Great wallet, love the design.  I'm marking it down a star because after only 6 months or so of use it's starting to fray a bit; but for only $15, i'll just get another when it does finally wear out.
This wallet has been perfect for me when I don't want to take my purse out.

Have to give this a 5 because it does exactly what I expected and for the price it is hard to beat. Simple and performs well. This was my first move from your typical leather tri-fold and I was skeptical but would never go back. I have had two, replaced the first one after 16 months because it started to frey and look a little beaten. My second I have carried for exactly 2 years and it is still in great shape. It goes everywhere and is in and out of my Baseball coaching bag a lot. It gets dropped, banged around, and as far as a wallet goes has held up to fair abuse and shows better than expected wear and tear. I carry about 12 cards regularly and cash (maybe up to ten bills) in the front pocket or if I am actively pulling cash in and out of my wallet at an event I leave it tucked in the band. I also use the front pocket for receipts when traveling. The rubber wears on the inside of the Elastic band at the top of your cards like others have stated, but it really makes no difference. The band itself holds everything in place. Great, simple product, correctly priced.
summary: My second I have carried for exactly 2 years and it is still in great shape. It goes everywhere and is in and ...

reviewText: Nice wallet!
Everything I thought it would be ! Thanks
Great.
Loved it. It's very well made and works nicely with my phone.

I like it, and will use it without returning it, but it's pretty disappointing to see a couple of things. The packaging was pretty awful. It's literally in a plastic ziploc style baggie, and wasn't labeled as anything. Don't expect to give this as a gift without getting creative with the packaging, and also another thing. Fixing your brand new wallet you might be giving someone- luckily I wasn't....I have a stitch coming out of my wallet on day 1 straight from the packaging. Didn't even put cards in it or cash.. I didn't take a photo, but I burnt off the thread so hopefully it doesn't fray anymore. Kinda upsetting to see that I have to put work into something that's seemingly designed well. Onto the good. Well I guess it holds things, and forces you to pick what you carry, which I enjoy. The way I carry my cash in the wallet lets it kind of overhang the cards, but still makes everything super accessible. I'll update with any news as I get it, so far the experience has been less than ideal.
summary: Really? Plastic baggie? Thread showing? I'm kind of crabby guys..

reviewText: It likely will not be as durable as I hope.  The band that goes around the cards will be the likely failure point.  How long it lasts is the real question.

This is my first minimalist wallet and I was nervous about the switch.  The quality of the Crabby Wallet is great and I was used to the switch from a standard wallet (back pocket) to a minimalist wallet (front pocket) after just a day or two.

I've been using this wallet for a couple of months now and I've only had one issue.  There is a rubber strip under the strap that helps keep the strap from sliding off of things you have wrapped it around.  This strip of rubber has basically been cut by rubbing on the edge of my credit cards and is just starting to peel off a bit.  I personally don't mind, since I don't wrap it around anything else and it doesn't help or hinder my usage of the wallet.  Other than that, it hasn't shown any wear or tear and has worked for everything I have thrown at it.  If it ever does wear out, I wouldn't hesitate to grab another one.
holding onto it for the summer months and pool time - looks good and will meet my needs.
summary: ... for the summer months and pool time - looks good and will meet my needs

reviewText:
Crabby wallet is pretty good, but it has its faults.

Pros:
Very clean, very tidy for cards. I've found over time that 3 pockets would be ideal for me.
Very compact design, does what it's intended to do.

Cons:
Half pro/half con - The wallet lasted about 2-3 years, it's not falling apart per se, but over time things in your pocket (corner of your cell phone case, edge of your keys/keychains etc) will inevitably start to pull or expose threads. Even now my wallet holds together fine, but theres dangles of thread / the elastic has some ... elastic bands missing from the threading from wear and tear. If you NEVER put your wallet with anything else, it's probably indestructible, but then, who only carries a wallet?

The side loop. You'd think it'd be useful for a key or whatever.. Eh, now you can buy a small credit card sized storage box to put a few coins / SD cards / keys in. I ended up cutting mine off because it started ripping off, and i didn't even have the metal on it anymore, i'm talking about just the fabric portion. All in all, could do without it.

All in all, 4/5, but docking it because it's not as permanent of a wallet, although to be fair I see the new Crabbies are less fabric and more cloth... So i may be sticking with the same company... I'd love to try one out.
summary: Crabby wallet is pretty good, but it has its faults

reviewText: Perfect for travel.

After a few months of using it - I've noticed some frayed stitches but that hasn't affected the case much. If it lasts me a year - I would consider it a great purchase.

reviewText: This is absolutely the best wallet I have every had.  I'm a professional whose bifold traditional wallet became over bloated and began to make my back sore from sitting on it for so long.  When I moved my bloated bifold wallet to my front pocket, it began to bind my junk by pulling my pants tight.  The Crabby Wallet allowed me to pare down to only the essentials.  I keep my DL, CHL, CC, health insurance card, and cash in the wallet.  I also have a flash drive attached to the key-ring holder which tucks under the stretchy band.  I have taken my pockets back!  Thanks Crabby Gear!
Amazing and very special product!

UPDATE: I have owned this wallet for several months now.  I bought it for my current deployment with the Army to the Middle East.  I am in and out of this wallet several times a day and it has held up perfectly!  Perfect for holding credit cards! Just as little and awesome as pictured.  I am tempted to buy a few more for when it does finally break down on me.  I love it that much and don't want to go back to any other wallet.

I have had this Crabby Wallet for 3 1/2 years. I Love it. Small, compact, has held up well. I carry 8 cards, 2 IDs, and 5 reward cards.

To those who say it is unorganized, I don't find it so. In the main pocket I keep my Debit card on one side, my IDs on the other, Medical cards in the middle, ect.  Cash gets folded and put in the front shorter pocket.

The elastic has a wee hole in one bottom corner, it's barely noticeable and does not compromise the integrity of the wallet. The purple elastic keeper strap isn't smooth anymore but it still does it's job. Hey, it's been 3 1/2 years of constant near daily use.

Very pleased with this wallet and will definitely buy another one when this one gets worn out.
summary: It's been 3 1/2 years, Holding up very well.

reviewText: Small secure

This wallet is sweet. It holds everything in place. I've tried to make it spill my cards and couldn't make it happen. This thing is slim enough to fit in my front pocket with comfort. This wallet certainty doesn't make me crabby.

You will have to fold bank notes in thirds or quarters but that is not an issue as you have to do this with almost all minimalist wallets. Fully loaded with 10 cards and ten banknotes it is still acceptably slim.
Construction is entirely of stretchy nylon so I'm not sure of the longevity or robustness of this item. Time will tell.
Personally I'm not keen on the attached lanyard. I have no use for it but I could see some people attaching a key.
Overall a good product

reviewText:
First off i want to say 4 stars and not 5 because pricing is not fair in my opinion.
I would pay no more than $8 for this wallet at most.  This is not because the wallet is bad but for the material its made out of and how small it is i don't see how it can cost $15+.

The wallets design is great.  The wallet stays small and flat with 4 to 5 cards and some cash.  I love the little string that hangs, i use it for my keys.  I really like how this wallet stays small and its very easy to carry when i go to the gym or out for a run.  The little strap is used to keep the cards in but i also use it to strap around my phone when i don't have pockets.

One concern i have is how long itll last.  The material doesnt seem like it can handle too much wear and tear but it isn't extreamly delicate either.  I could probably estimate a good year of heavy use out of it.

All in all i enjoy having this around.  Not my everyday carry but definitely gets used often.

reviewText: Just got my Crabby wallet in a few days ago and it definitely surprises me at how thin it is. I hate bulky wallets and I cringe when I see people pull them out of their pockets lol. I'm in the military as well and I need something that's thin and light and this fits perfectly in my uniform no problem! Front or back pocket, it's barely noticeable. Get this! ''

The wallet is super thin and made of a sturdy material that will not get stretched out even after repeated use. The pockets are large enough to hold about 10-12 credit cards and the money will need to be tri-folded up to fit in the smaller pocket.  It fits well in the a front pocket and adds very little bulk compared to a traditional wallet.

Loved this wallet before it failed- but it is not built to last! The wallet encouraged me to slim down the number of cards I carry, cut down on cash, and just not have to deal with a George Costanza wallet anymore. However, it cannot stand up to the wear and tear of daily use. The elastic band on my wallet is shot and the wallet no longer holds cards inside- in less than a year.. Crabby's wallet is a great idea, but other companies probably execute much better.

reviewText:
This is a perfect minimalist wallet and it is made of quality material.
I have been looking for a good thin and compact wallet for a while, and Crabby Wallets are perfect for my needs.
I can easily put an ID, 4 other cards and few bills inside those compact wallet; in addition, there is also a loop that I can attach my car key to it securely.
Overall, I am very happy with this purchase, and it is well worth the five stars rating!
I have included few photos for you to look at the details of the product.
Since I really like the design, I also bought the polyester and leather versions.
The last photo of mine shows the comparison of those crabby wallets, and the leather one is slightly longer than others, but I feel it can definitely last longer.
This original crabby wallet is the least expensive among those three wallets, and the material is stretchy.

To sum up, I listed some Pros and Cons below.
Pros:
1. Very well made product with quality materials.
2. The product price is reasonable.
3. Very easy to use and compact.
4. The color is nice.
5. Well-designed product and does its job perfectly.

Cons:
1. The polyester and leather versions seem better made and can last longer

If this review is helpful to you, please help me by clicking the Yes below; this would really encourage me to give better reviews in the future. Thank you very much =)

reviewText:
I saw this on Amazon and thought I would give it a try as I was tired of having my current "traditional wallet" slip out of my back pocket and this Minimalist wallet was designed to be carried in your front pocket.  There were a number of great things that came from this:
1.  I had to clean out my old wallet, and get rid of a bunch of stuff I never used and didn't need (a great experience)
2.  As this wallet also hold your keys, I minimized the keys I would keep with me to just three, and attached them to the small clasp

I ended up with a very small package that is slightly larger than your credit cards and fits nicely in your front pocket (even with the keys attached).  I've been using it for about a week and don't miss my old wallet at all.  Its very light, and pretty easy access to anything you need.  The green band snaps over the credit/card money edge to keep things from falling out, and is easy to remove to get access to wallet items.

I also have one of the thin tiles in the crabby wallet in case I lose it (the Tile has a BLE link so I can find it the wallet's location using my cell phone), and the wallet still functions great (not too thick).

The green band can also wrap around your cellphone, and I've tried this but think it makes the wallet too bulky so I don't use it, but others might like it or perhaps you can use it at night to keep your wallet and cellphone together; but not really great combination for the pocket.

I'm very happy I made the move to change my wallet, and would recommend this to others.

I am a security guard and it's annoying to have to carry your cards, car key, spare cash, and licenses in your pocket. This is perfect because it fits all of that in my pocket so well that I constantly freak out thinking I've lost them until I feel for it in my pocket. The detachable key is perfect because I can easily take it off to run my truck although I've recently started to just leave the wallet dangling from the key while it's in the ignition. People have been complaining about the elastic strap that holds everything together but I think it's not only super necessary, but fairly easy to take off to grab a card out for a purchase. The only drawback I've seen is that the wallet's crisp color is definitely starting to get tarnished from its constant use, but other than that, it shows no wear.
summary: So small I barely notice it in my pocket!

reviewText: Great minimalist wallet.
Killer design!

Yes, you have to downsize your wallet or there's no point. I downsized my wallet to three licenses (driver license, pilot license and state bar card) plus four credit/debit cards, car key and house key plus some cash. Reward cards live on my phone or in my car. This is perfect for that load. It could hold a few more cards if needed but that would start to defeat the purpose. The material his very elastic and is tight whether you have one card or several like I do.

You can tuck your phone in it, but that makes the whole thing look a lot less minimalistic. Nevertheless, an S7 with protective case fits and I imagine the S7 edge or Note 7 would fit too, it would just look kind of ridiculous and would cease to be very minimalistic. Also with a large key fob, it doesn't work so well to tuck the key into the side but it makes the whole wallet fat and kind of defeats the purpose. However, the built-in keychain is a very, very good idea because your wallet and keys are always together and you're far less likely to misplace your keys.

At this price, you really can't go wrong IF you're committed to eliminating everything you don't absolutely have to have from your wallet. For some, myself included, it feels good if not slightly bittersweet.
Everything about it is great
this is great

I wish I had this wallet decades ago.  LOVE IT.  After two months the inner gummy strip on the "money band" is starting to peel but that's no big deal. the band works fine without it.

This will be my "go-to" for future gifts.
summary: Try it.  You will not be disappointed.

reviewText:
This wallet works great for me. I've had it for about a month now and have had no issues with it.  I keep 6 cards (credit/debit/gas/license/insurance...), a double-thick security key card, plus on occasion 1-4 folded checks and/or 3-4 folded bills.
If I have to carry more bills, I just keep them out and in a separate pocket. It works exactly the way I expected it to work. The material is stretchy enough that I can open it and see which card I want to pull. Is it tight? Yes. I particularly like the attached (sewn) stretch band that wraps around the wallet. I feel like it provides extra security. That same strap is stretchy enough that can use it to attach the wallet to my phone and placed in my front pocket for extra security. The materials appear to be durable. after a month of daily use it still looks brand new. ------- 17 months after purchase ------  Best wallet I've EVER had. I use it every day and it is still rocking along. The last 4 pics are of how it looks now. Hardly any wear and the elastic is still as tight as the first day.
summary: Just what I was looking for in a compact wallet.

I love not having to put my wallet in my back pocket for ergonomics and safety reasons. I highly recommend this wallet
I work on construction and and somewhat rough on things I wear everyday. This wallet has held up like a champ. Wish these guys made gloves!

Working with the strap is mildly annoying during transactions, but feels worth it so far.

Awesome slim front pocket wallet. This is my second Crabby wallet. The rubber on the elastic strap (used to hold money) wore out and peeled off and the stitching wears out quickly. Still works well without it, but don't be surprised when it peels off. I've tried other slim pocket wallets in the past and this one seems to be the most functional while staying slim. Good price for a good product.

I love my Crabby Wallet! If you're still lugging around a big fat wallet in your back pocket, ditch it! I found that I almost never use most of the things in my wallet. I scanned all of the rarely-used items (medical cards, store loyalty cards, etc) into a phone app and left them in a drawer. My Crabby Wallet has my driver's license, a debit card, a credit card, and occasionally a few bills. It's thin, lightweight, and organized. I tried a money clip before this, and it was heavier and actually thicker than the Crabby Wallet. I got rid of the keychain lanyard and put on a quarter-sized GPS tracker after spending one morning looking for my lost wallet.

I love this thing, and I don't think I'll ever go back to a fat wallet. Try it, you'll love it!

I opted to remove the key lanyard. It didn't work for me since I have to carry a bunch of keys.

I had carried an old-fashioned leather duo-fold that kept things pretty loosely, so this little wallet feels extra-tiny at first. As I slipped it into my pocket, it seemed to disappear, but that became a positive attribute. It does not draw attention to where you carry your wallet. I'm tickled with the wallet and happy about my purchase.

This wallet is definitely thin and minimalist. I only carry around 4-5 cards and didn't want anything fancy. I initially thought to get a phone case wallet, but 1) I didn't like the designs, 2) they looked too flimsy, or 3) looked like too much effort to open and take out the cards.

I finally settled on this wallet and it's super easy to remove and put back the cards into the slots. The band that secures the cards keeps me at ease knowing that there's no way my cards will accidentally fall out. I can also secure the wallet to my phone with the band. I don't do it a lot, but it's an option if I ever want to keep my phone and wallet together.

I also carry a diaper bag full of baby's things. I like that I can throw this wallet and my phone into the bag when I'm on the go and it doesn't take up much space in the bag.

I would NOT recommend this wallet if:
1) you carry around a lot of cards, like more than 10-ish cards - it's not meant to be stuffed with cards.
2) you carry a lot of cash or want to save receipts - it's do-able to stuff cash/paper receipts in here, but just kind of inconvenient. plastic cards are easy to slip into the pockets. but with paper, you have to pull the pocket out to stuff it in.
3) if you carry change
summary: Perfect for my needs, but might not work for everyone.

reviewText:
When I first received the Crabby Wallet, I was shocked at how slim it was. When empty it's about the thickness of 2 credit cards. It feels decently made. It's obviously not the kind of quality you'll get out of a leather wallet, but for being made out of a stretchy fabric it felt nice. It's reasonably durable too. Other people must have gotten lemons, because I used mine every day for 2 months and the only problem with the wallet is the rubber strip on the inside of the band is coming off; it would be easily be fixed with some glue. It's convenience is about what you would expect from a wallet with 2 pockets. For some people, it might be hard to locate some of their cards if they have a lot of them. I only have about 7 so it was pretty manageable. The stretchiness of the wallet is helpful in that you are able to open the wallet up a bit to see your cards. The key loop is entirely useless. I put my keys on it for 2 days and it was absolutely dreadful. I would try and grab my keys and my wallet would be stuck in my pocket or vice versa. This is due in part to the fact that I wear very tight jeans, but I'd imagine it'd be inconveniencing for anyone. Any problems I had with the wallet were very minor, and I thought it was a great addition to the market of minimalist wallets for people that don't want to spend 100 dollars on a reinforced carbon fiber double RIFD titanium infused smart wallet or something of that sort. That said, I recently stopped using the wallet and switched back to my leather bifold wallet. In my opinion, the wallet, while being quite functional and handy, just looks a bit cheap. But I guess that's what you get for 15 dollars.

I received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: Good minimalist wallet for the price

reviewText:
Being my first minimalist wallet, I was really excited for this little guy. Unfortunately, the edge stitching started coming off after 2 weeks, which seemed lead to the entire bottom unraveling slowly (see photo). Over the next couple months, the gel-like lining under the band (provides traction) started peeling off, and now that's all but gone too.

I've always been really easy on the wallet, so I'm not sure if I just got a bad copy or what. Love the concept though, as long as you can get one that stays together. I know $15 is nothing for a durable wallet, but I'm not really a fan of paying $15 for a new wallet every few months.
summary: Great design, but the construction quality killed it for me

reviewText:
It's as advertised, and the quality is fine--but it's TINY, just 2 inches by about 3-7/8. It may hold 10 cards (I don't have 10 to test it), but they poke out the top, and there's no place at all to carry cash. U.S. currency has to be folded in quarters to fit into the small compartments, so a few bills fill it up, and the elastic band is too loose to secure them outside. I question the durability of that strap, too. It doesn't feel like it will withstand a few thousand stretches.
 If you travel with one or two cards, rarely use cash and don't wind up with a wad of $1 bills every day, this could work for you as a front-pocket wallet for occasional use. It doesn't work at all for me.

UPDATE: Unfortunately, it has fallen apart. First, the clasp ripped open the loop on the wallet, and then the seam began to come out of the elastic. The pockets are in decent shape, with only a few rubber bands sticking out from the bottom, and the green elastic strap still binds it all together pretty well, but it's got a tag flap where the loop used to be.

I usually don't gush over stuff I buy, but I like this wallet way more than I expected! My regular wallet barely closes because of the stuff I carry, and it can look bulky in my pocket. I've tried a lot of different clips, but they are usually heavy and clang when I move. When I need a card, I have to take everything out and shuffle to find what I need. What's worse, sometimes the clips fall out of my pocket because the my pocket is too shallow, who makes that a constant worry! The Crabby Wallet takes care of all that and then some. It's made of light, elastic fabric. It holds the cards I need, and let's me view them without removing them all. I can fold bills and tuck them in, with the band to wrap and secure it all. Because I'm so used to the bulge in my pocket, at first I was always patting my thighs to make sure I didn't lose things. The Crabby Wallet has the loop that can tether it, which is a lifesaver! Now, I sometimes check my pockets, but I end up happy to see whoever I'm meeting! I bought the Crabby Wallet at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest review, and it might be my best purchase of the year!

reviewText:
I have actually been looking for a minimal wallet for some time, and even though I travel a lot and am able to check out various markets and stores I just never found anything I liked. But finally, this one has turned out to be exactly what I was looking for.

One of the things I hated about leather wallets is how over time they get slippery and cards can slip out. So I wanted something that held everything in. Check. Also, I just wanted two simple compartments, one for money, one for cards. Check. And of course, a very small size that fits in my pocket and doesn't have to be moved if I sit down. Check.

I was a bit concerned when I got it because it looked really small! But when I took everything out of my old walled, and loaded this one up, I realized it is made of a durable, stretchy material and I put 5 cards (credit cards, drivers license, etc.) on one side, some folded cash on the other, and it fit just fine. I also like the elastic. It has a small strip of rubbery material on the inside that keeps it in place really well so it doesn't slide around. I did get this at a discount for giving an unbiased review, but I can honestly say this is exactly what I was looking for all along. I highly recommend this wallet, and from the feel of the materials I sense it will last a very long time as well.
summary: Exactly what I was looking for

reviewText: I really like this. I can't believe how small it is.
Very cool minimalist wallet.  I carry 4 cards (two debit and two credit) and two ID cards and this is perfect.  What's cash?

This little wallet is great for keeping all of my pocket junk neat and tidy along with eliminating that horrible and uncomfortable back packet bulge that I hate. I wear slightly slimmer pants and can't stand a lot of stuff in my pockets digging into me throughout the day, so this seemed like an obvious solution and it does the job perfectly.
I've been using it for just about two weeks now and it's held up great, no fraying or wild threads waving about anywhere, I love the elastic construction, good lookin embroidered crab, and the little gummy strip on the band for traction, it's a well thought out minimal design that does what it's supposed to without any disappointment so far.
I keep about 5 plastic cards, a few bills of cash, 1-3 paper punch cards, and whatever pocket change I might have on me in there and it all stays secure and slim. I'd try keeping my keys loaded into it as well but I have too many and my key ring does just fine with no fuss.
Although I received it at a discount, that hasn't swayed my judgement any and my opinion is completely honest and my own. I'd definitely recommend picking it up if you don't carry an insane amount of stuff in your wallet or you're looking to cut down your load a bit, the crab won't let you down!

I received this product for a discount for my honest review and feedback.  This wallet is super small.  Very very small.  It's a not traditional leather wallet but is kinda cool in this way.  It's perfect for the beach, snow sports or really anything you may be doing that could get your wallet wet.  It's durable and dries quickly.  The band holds the cards inside the wallet snuggly.  The cards will not go anywhere.  The wallet will hold about 4-5 cards easily.  I put it in my shoe when snowboarding and it fits very well without issues.

"This product was provided at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review."

I use a wallet for ID and a couple of credit or key cards. I don't carry cash or condoms in it, although recently I had my dad's back-up safe deposit box key in there because there was room. I've tried a few options instead of a traditional wallet: the metal card case, the money clip/card holder combo and just the ID case from a wallet. I like this one more than those options for a couple of reasons: it's impossibly compact yet holds a bunch of cards, the wide elastic strap keeps it all in place, and the small cord let's me keep a small wallet-sized external phone charger with my stuff without requiring a full wallet.

Since my grown up life doesn't involve me taking clients to dinner or other scenarios where a dignified traditional wallet wouldn't undermine any confidence others have in me, I have no problem with the unusual look of the wallet. I've been using a fairly small plastic Batman wallet for about a year and it was impossible to use the individual card slots efficiently; I'm happy they offer a similar color motif. See photos for size comparison.

I was worried that the small size and light weight would make me paranoid I didn't have it with me. Adding the external phone charger thing helps with that.

Going to the gym, hiking, night on the town, you can throw your basic cards and money in this and you are set.. I don't attach my keys to it very often, but I do find that feature very handy. I carry my two favorite credit cards and money in the first easy access pocket, and then have my driver's license and health insurance, car insurance, cards in the main pocket. I can still add additional cards and it fits fine, plus when I take them out, it shrinks back down to size. Ryan hit a home run with this product!
summary: I love it! Even better than the original. A great product for men or women.

This little Crabby Wallet is the cutest thing. Pardon me but i had to say it! It is ideal for traveling on the road, train or bus. It will hold your ticket and allows for you to carry just the major necessities and nothing more!!! For instance, let's say you are traveling and the train/bus that you are traveling on makes a stop at a station or rest area....vending machines are available or a small eatery of some sort. You can place all of your necessities inside this little wallet, leaving your purse in the overhead compartment and go purchase your things without having to rummage for your wallet to make a purchase. Little Crabby to the rescue! It fits right in the palm of your hand.

  From your car, you may not want to bring your whole purse with you. You can place your cash or credit card inside the wallet, even though the wallet is smaller than the norm, that wide rubber band will hold your card down and the pressure from that and the card will hold your cash as well. On the inside of the wide band are strips of rubber, to grip the purse. No chance of it sliding off. There is a loop where you can slip your finger(s) through it for extra security. It will easily fit in your pockets.

  I absolutely adore this little gem. I sometimes travel by train and this will hold my boarding ticket and any cash or card if I need it for purchasing special items.

  *Crabby is lightweight

  *Available in a variety of colors - ladies, you can match your other purse accessories

  *Great use even for a pre-teen to use at school for purchasing lunch, vending machine items or items from the school store.
  Some students now have to carry student ID cards to make purchases at their school so this would be perfect for them

  *The only thing that I would like even more about this wallet...would be that the band would be located more in the middle of the
  of the wallet than on the end. I feel that would make it even more secure. As of now, I feel like my cash would slip out....even
  though it hasn't and probably wont. I, myself alone would be more....comfortable....if the band was in the middle.
  But, that's just me ya'll.

  I have received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I received this product at a discount for my fair and honest options.

Purchased for the 2nd time!  I love my Crabby Wallet.  I used to have use a trifold leather wallet that used to be quick a pain...literally.  Ever since switching to this minimalist wallet, I have been able to comfortable put it in my front pocket without added much bulk.  This means less back pain and better security (I ride a subway train regularly).  I have had my current wallet for about a year, and it is holding up quite well.  I purchased a second one as a Christmas gift to myself as a back-up.  It is a great, simple product that just works.  Absoulutely the best minimalist wallet that I have found to date.

I've been looking for a suitable replacement for my Eagle Creek Bi-Fold Travel Wallet. I have had it for years and it's an earlier version of the current one. It was great at 3.5" wide and a little over 4" tall. It's still intact except for the leather decorative strip on the front that wore/cracked/dried out. I'd still use it, but it really looks horrible and my girlfriend has something to say about that. So, I ordered the Crabby Wallet. I have not used the first version, so I did not know what to expect with this one.

The first thing I did when I got it was take off the ring for keys. I wanted to use this as minimal as possible. It's small and I love it! It's not really a wallet though. It's more of a card holder. I put in 4 plastic cards and a few business cards and I am good to go. All in all, it is less than 2.5" wide and almost 4" high. Did I say I love it yet? Well, I do. I like to keep my wallet in my front pocket and appreciate that it is not bulky.

I do not keep money in it, even folded. From one of a reviewer's pictures, they fold a bill and put it under the elastic strap. I can see myself pulling the elastic strap when getting a card out and dropping the cash. Most likely, in a situation when I am not paying attention and then I am out XXX number of dollars. No big deal. I keep my cash elsewhere.

The elastic strap does give me a secure feeling that the cards will not fall out, but it's a tight fit anyway, so it's just added protection. The one picture in the Seller's description that I saw when I can take advantage of the elastic strap is when strapping it to a cell phone. When flying, it's so much easier have the least number of items to take out of your pockets. I can connect my phone and this wallet and know I just have to pick up one less thing. It's small, but of big value to me. If you have a larger phone, especially with a case., it may be pushing it to try to get your phone under that strap.

I would hope this lasts longer than my Eagle Creek, but time will tell. I will update this review accordingly. All in all, this is great if you don't use your wallet for additional storage and just for basic essentials. I recommend it highly!

If you have any questions about this product, just ask. Also, if this review was helpful in any way, please click "Yes" to "Was this review helpful to you?" below. I would appreciate it!
summary: Love it! Replaced an Eagle Creek Travel Bi-fold wallet.

reviewText: This is the perfect size for those looking to pare down what is in their wallet. I bought this prior to a short trip to Florida, followed by a vacation in Maine before returning home. I wanted to reduce what I was carrying and figured I'd get a wallet to match. I carried it within the internal pocket of a Maxpedition Micro Pocket Organizer (Black). This wallet performed so well that it is now my everyday carry wallet at home. I started my trip with just six currency bills under the elastic strap, but after getting change from my first cash purchase, I was suddenly carrying twice the number of bills. The currency must be folded into fourths to fit under the elastic, which means the wad of bills is pretty thick with all those folds. Given this situation, it was much easier for the bills to catch onto pants or pouch material as it was removed. When this happened, the elastic band will actually help shove the currency away from the wallet once it gets past a certain point. Not an ideal situation if you're in a hurry as you may have your attention elsewhere and not notice. Something to keep in mind if you think "oh I'll just carry a few twenties or a hundred dollar bill." Once you get your change back, you're now into "high stack mode" with this wallet
summary: Great Wallet for Minimum Carry, not the best for wads of cash

reviewText:
Really like this wallet and it's not just for men! I hate having to lug a big pocketbook around when I go to concerts, movies or sporting events so the Crabby Wallet is perfect for keeping everything secure and easily fits in the front pocket of my jeans.
Please note that the Crabby Wallet comes in many color choices- I ordered the pink but as you can see from the pictures it arrived in green- some  one messed up! I know that Amazon is really good about returns but I am not going to bother with returning it.
The width easily accommodates credit cards and money but note that the height is much shorter than paper money so you will have to fold your bills a few times for it to fit properly in the wallet. I don't think it is very practical to attach your key to the wallet- makes things a bit complicated. I would prefer to keep it simple and just use it for money and credit cards.
I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review and I am happy to say I have no hesitations about recommending it. Very useful extra wallet to have around.
summary: This Lady loves it- Not just for Men

reviewText:
The Crabby Wallet is more portable than practical.

You are able to fit a lot of items in a small amount of space while being visually aware of where everything is.

Yes, it's very portable, being tight-knit and easy to carry around, but actually using it for transactions in a real world setting can be troublesome

The compact design is not as functional as bi fold or other slim wallets I've used in the past. With no individualized card slots and force folding money you'll have to shuffle through cards/cash while standing at the cashiers especially when the card or individual bill you want is towards the center of the stack.

The band fits everything securely, but after unbinding it can getting out what you want, it's a chore to put everything back to where it was depending where the item is located and what's attached to the strap. By the time the transaction is finished, you may feel awkward stepping to the side and putting everything in place. Often times if there is a long line with a lot of on lookers, I would just stuff everything in my pocket and go to a bench or my car to put everything neatly in place to avoid the embarrassment

The Crabby wallet is very stylish and looks good when showing it off in public (just don't show it in action when at full performance). The wallet is more functional with a minimalist lifestyle, but you will still encounter the problem stated above.

Its able to fit both traditional a 5inch phone and also 6 inch phablet on the strap, just that the phablet looks a bit awkward.

If you're looking for a very stylish wallet that is portable it's a good purchase, but know that you have to take extra steps when actually in use
