reviewText: After years of carrying a bulky wallet, I decided it was time to slim down and go the minimalist route. I decided the Crabby Wallet was a good starting point. The Crabby Wallet is made of an stretchy fabric, which makes it adapt well to what you put in it. The pocket on the front can stretch a bit and I was able to get about 5 cards in there, but ideally you would have maybe only 2 cards and some bills in the front and the rest in the big pocket. I had about 10 cards stuffed in the large pocket, and I'd say this will comfortably fit about 12 cards. The outer strap wraps around the wallet to help secure what's in it as well as allowing you to fit larger objects like a cell phone. Even with this many cards loaded in, the wallet is still really thin and feels great in the pocket. Not everything is perfect with this wallet though. It was immediately clear after a couple of weeks of use that this fabric won't hold up long term. After a month and a half the strap already felt a bit loose. Also I really don't like the big red crab logo or red text with the Crabby Wallet name (the color of this text changes with other color bands but everyone gets the red crab). The keyhook is nice, I guess, but really only good for one or two keys and not a big keychain. Lastly, the wallet really doesn't look all that professional (partly because of the crab logo) and I felt kind of silly using it sometimes.
summary: good starter wallet for a minimalist lifestyle

reviewText: Heard V1 was lacking in quality with heavy use. V2 does not have that problem at all. I love this wallet. Keep a few cards, some cash, and key to my bike lock all together. reviewText: My Costanza wallet is now Crabby'd. I love it!

The perfect minimalist wallet. I have been an owner of a Crabby Wallet since the original Kickstarter. Many people use it as a small wallet for travel, biking, or going to the gym. I use mine all the time. It is small enough to fit in my front pocket without being uncomfortable and is so light and slim that I hardly notice it. It has enough room for me to easily keep 3 credit cards, a driver's license, other ID, and 5-10 bills with room to spare. You could fit double that if you wanted, but my whole goal in moving to a minimalist wallet was to get rid of all the extra junk I carried around for no reason.

The elastic band keeps items secure inside the wallet. I never worry about things falling out. I do not personally use the lobster claw keychain, but my daughter uses hers for her car keys and has not had any problems with it. I have owned my V2 for about 6 months, and with daily use as my primary wallet it shows no signs of wear.

The V2 wallet fixed a few of the minor issues people experienced in the original. The original version was slightly smaller so cards were a tighter fit and some people had issues with durability, particularly with the elastic band. I did not experience problems with my original after a year of dailyuse, but I upgraded to the V2 because it is a better design and I passed my V1 on to one of my kids.
Perfect minimalist wallet. I've searched fire the perfect wallet for years... One that is small enough but big enough. The crabby wallet is the best.

I love this wallet. The entire thing is an elastic pouch with two pockets. The larger pouch area is to hold cards. The smaller is for something you need to access a lot. The band is also elastic with a band of rubberized material to help it grip the cards. I keep five cards on it and it is super slim. I could shove a few more on. The edges will wear and fray with time, I can see that from using it. Cloth on cloth keeps a lot of friction. I took off the super cheap key holder that came with it and attached a lanyard. I use the lanyard to turn it into a chain wallet type device. Its great. I can slip bills into it if I want but they have to be folded up which makes them thicker. Its not going to be a thick wallet, ever, its not built that way. But, for those who want to hold some cards and have minimal fuss it is incredible.

Great wallet, holds all I need! I even put my iphone on the back and it does not fall out. The only thing that would make it even better would be if that band that holds the iphone is clear somehow so that I can still see and use all functions of the phone without having to take it out of the band.
summary: Great wallet, holds all I need

reviewText:
I've been using this wallet for about 2 weeks.
Till now I'm amazed by its size and capacity. I use it to hold about 7 cards and 2 keys and some cash.
summary: Till now I'm amazed by its size and capacity

reviewText: Quality and price were outstanding. Thank you!

I have only owned it for a week, but I love this wallet.  First hurdle, was convincing myself that I didn't need a leather wallet or card holder.
I thought to myself that nobody would take a guy seriously that pulled out a Crabby looking wallet out of his pocket.  No woman would date a guy with such a weird taste.  I am comfortable taking this out of my pocket.  Excellent build quality, doesn't look like an elastic wallet.

For the past twenty years I have carried many many non folding card holder wallet.  After a year or less they stretch out.  Cards don't stay in the pockets.  I have numerous times pulled my leather card holders out and depending on the angle when it comes out of your pocket cards have fallen out.  I have lost a unused $50 starbucks card because of this.

Enter the Crabby... the entire wallet is made of elastic and the strap that goes over the cards is fantastic.  I no longer fear cards falling out.

This wallet is not for everyone... If you have not figured out how to simplify your life and live without all the stuff in your inch thick folding or trip fold wallet then you should pass.  If you need to flip your wallet open and see your cash and be able to flip through your bills, this isn't the wallet for you.
I prefer my wallet in my front pocket and cash in my other front pocket.  When i used to carry a huge wallet in my back pocket it gave me back issues from sitting on my wallet in the car, work, etc.

I can't comment on the keychain.  Haven't used it.

If you enjoy simplicity and minimalism, then you will love this wallet.  If anything changes I will edit my review to reflect it.
summary: I do not like green eggs and ham...

reviewText: Fantastic!

I love how slim this wallet is. I was able to fit everything i needed into it. I does not bulk up my pockets and is easy to use. I feel everything is secure and won't fall out. Its so thin, i am often checking to make sure i have not forgotten my wallet. (You know, the panic pocket taps)

Definitely buy this wallet if you are looking for something that is easy to use and slim.

I thought this little wallet was more of a joke until; I started transferring the cards I need to carry into it.  Now my cash, credit cards, health cards, driver's license, and more;are securely held in place. It takes up less than one third of the room my old wallet did and I can now carry it in my front  pocket.
  I've now had this wallet for a couple months and it's going strong, no problems with quality or the amount of necessary cards it holds
summary: Far More Than A Rubber Band

reviewText: My favorite wallet ever! Do yourself a favor and get one now...
Looking at this review? Buy this wallet. Period.
I love how small the wallet is and  holds everything I need!
Slim, perfect and holds everything in tightly.  Band has not loosened at all.  I don't use the key ring feature.  its a wallet not a key chain.
summary: perfect and holds everything in tightly

reviewText: Really great design.  I love it!
summary: Great solution to my wallet problem

reviewText: Awesome! I have been using money clip type wallets for years now. Always finding some new clip and finding a way to squeeze cards, cash etc into it. This thing fits everything I had in my previous fossil clip, without the bulk. Easy to get stuff out of, holds cards secure and I keep having to check to see that it's there because it's so small.  Liked it so much that I ordered a second for my son.
summary: Awesome! I have been using money clip type wallets ...

reviewText: So far the best wallet I have ever owned! I totally recommend this wallet if you prefer to keep your wallet light.
Received on time and as stated
Nice wallet for those who don't like bulky pockets!
Great

I was skeptical going into this purchase I will admit it.  This wallet is built really well.  The security strap is what really makes this a great product.  don't feel like my cards are going to slip out.  Shipping and service was quick.  If I had to provide any feedback it's that I would love to see a version of this wallet with the opposite orientation (portrait instead of horizontal).  Another neat addition would be to add jelly strips like those found on the security strap to either the inside or outside of the wallet.  This would give the elastic the same type of resistance to stretching. Am I in love with it... not yet... but it's a great start
light and compact.  what I like best is the whole thing is elastic so it holds cards securely and doesn't streatch out.  The key chain wasn't for me. I just took it off.
summary: never have your credit cards fall out of your wallet again!

reviewText:
This is a great wallet for people who hate clutter and like to be comfortable. Let me explain. I recently began using Evernote to go paperless. This wallet forces me to scan receipts and business cards immediately with my iPhone rather than store them in my wallet. There just isn't any room for clutter, but I can easily store my drivers license, insurance card and several credit cards.

I also like that it fits easily into the front pocket of of my pants. I used to hate sitting on a big bulky wallet and it wasn't particularly great for my back. This little wallet fits easily into the front pocket of slacks, jeans, and athletic pants & shorts. It's a win, win.

Quick Tip: The key chain works great for gym & loyalty cards. It keeps them handy and easy to find.
Love this wallet. Have had it for a few months. No issues. Well made. Don't think I'll buy another wallet.
This is my new favorite wallet. Ordered a second as a spare! Little strap broke off after a week but It seems to be mostly cosmetic anyhow. used the metal loop on my Night Eyez keychain.

I bought this item because the product was provided at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review. And I'm glad to report that except for its unexpectedly small size, the Crabby Gear wallet is awesome. It's a good idea and executed well. Sturdy, flexible, useful. Who could ask for anything more? The only surprise for me was that it is far smaller than I expected--probably because I didn't read the fine print. But the wallet without anything in it is tiny. My cell phone is bigger than it is. But because of the Crabby wallet's big elastic band and the wallet's ability to expand according to its contents, I am able to bring along anything I want. I can jam in a few cards (driver's license, bank card, school ID, credit card, library card), fold up some cash and stick it in, and attach my iPhone with the band. This afternoon I headed out to the movies and put the whole in my pocket. Ready to go. I think this would be especially great for traveling or if you're off to a bar or club and don't want a bulky purse or wallet. It's so small, thin, and versatile, you can just slip it in your pocket and not have to worry about losing your stuff while you're dancing.

This functional little wallet is wonderful for those on-the-go!  It's listed as a men's wallet, but I found it great to fit into a blouse pocket or the pocket of a pair of skinny jeans so that I don't get that unsightly bulge.  If you are a 'bra-tucker',  you can tuck this little wallet with all of your important things in your bra for safe-keeping.  I will definitely recommend to my friends!

This product was provided at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review.
summary: The Crabby Wallet grabs everything I need to carry!

reviewText: I think it's handy.  Would be good if it could hold change or some bills.  But I like it.
summary: Would be good if it could hold change or some bills

reviewText: can't remember where I found this, but it has definitely helped my butt feel a lot better! I had cleaned out my old wallet down to as thin as it would get, but it was still too thick to be comfortable sitting at my desk for hours. This is as thin as it gets. Not for everyone, but if you can narrow down your wallet to a handful of cards this will work for you.
The bare minimum is perfect. I can manage my expenses well, knowing that I only have so little with me.
Use it every day.
Been using my Crabby Wallet for awhile now. Love it !

I've been using it for a couple of days now and I really like the compact size. I'm liking this wallet more and more as I use it. I am coming from a leather bifold that was getting quite bulky. I've had to ditch my pack rat mentality which is necessary with this wallet.

It has one "outside" pocket that snugly fits 1-2 cards. I use it solely for the one credit card I use the most. Doing so, it allows me quick access and FAST deployment of my card. Since I store only one card in the outer pocket, there's no chance of taking out the wrong card or dropping other ones. I think this is what the creators intended.

The larger main pocket snugly holds my stack of about 8 cards. My strategy here is to place my next most commonly used cards at the top and bottom of the stack. In this way, I can easily and reliably access my driver's license and Costco card quickly as well. Knowing what cards are first and last in the stack allows me to take them out quickly without hunting. My less commonly used cards are actually towards the middle of the stack.

Now for cash what I've done is fold the bills in half and then half once more. Then what I do is insert one half of the "v" into the main pocket against my last card. (See my photos.) Doing so allows me to store and take out cash in a simple and reliable way. The elastic band the fits nicely around the contents of my wallet. Since the cash is fold in half twice, the bills don't get too beat up and fit sleekly in the wallet.

In summary, I think this is a really smart design for a minimalistic wallet. It's sleek, fast and straight forward. At first I thought the elastic loop was cumbersome but it does give you  piece of mind knowing that it'll ensure your contents stay in the wallet. For all you packrats out there thinking about slimming down your wallet, give this one a shot!

 Lastly, I purchased this wallet at a discounted rate for an honest and unbiased review.
summary: Crabby Wallet works like a charm!

reviewText: The best wallet I've had!

Love it. I use this as my everyday wallet. For those in healthcare, it is hard to find something that won't pull scrubs down! I carry my main credit card, 7 business cards, 4-5 cash bills, and my driver's license and it fits perfectly in this! It is so light weight I hardly feel it. I would recommend this to all healthcare personnel!

If I had a wishlist to the Crabby designers, I'd love an accessory that could clip to the tiny ring so I could clip it in a scrub pocket (has never come close to falling out, but I'd love that). Basically just a tiny binder clip would work great!

In short, I love this wallet. I've had a few slim front-pocket wallets in the past, but none have been as easy to adapt to as the Crabby Wallet. This wallet is very thin, lightweight, yet it still has two pockets and an elastic band that can hold additional items inside the wallet.

Pros:
 - Thin and lightweight
 - Multiple colors available
 - Holds plenty of cards (I carry at least 14 cards in my Crabby Wallet every day)
 - No butt-bulge from overstuffed wallets
 - No more lower back pain from sitting on a thick wallet
Cons:
 - The keychain is a bit useless to me. My car key is a flip-type key, so it won't fit, and I carry multiple keys on my regular key chain (house, office, cabinets, etc). I don't have just one key that would be fine to place with my Crabby Wallet. I ended up taking off the keychain and tossing it in the garbage.
 - Elastic tends to fray from time to time. A quick snip with scissors keeps the fraying from spreading.

The pictures I have added are of my wallet being 3 months old. I've since purchased a second Crabby Wallet for my partner as he likes how I never have a large bulge in my back pocket, nor do I complain of back pain from sitting on a thick wallet every day.

Note: This product was provided at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review.
summary: Back pain relieved - Less likely to bulk up with unnecessary cards and receipts

reviewText:
Edit: Well it's been a little over a month and it's fallen apart. The keychain hook broke off and some elastic strings are coming apart and looks ugly. It was nice when it was intact. Not worth the money if I knew it was only going to last a month.
--------------------------------------------------------
The Crabby wallet is my first minimal wallet. Carries all my cards (7 cards) and some cash and a work key attached to they keychain. It works as expected and really keeps my wallet slim. I can actually fit this in my front pocket unlike my older normal bifold wallet.

The one con I see with this is that it starts wearing out real quick. I've only only had it for almost a month and its starting to fray at the bottom near the crab logo.

I'm not sure how long this will last through normal use.
Love it. Exactly what I was looking for. Hope it lasts

I love this thing.  Very minimal.  Carrying 8 cards plus cash, it's not noticeably larger than just wrapping the cards in the cash like I used to do.  Materials look good, construction is very good.  Not sure what the little lanyard thing is for but maybe i'll find a use for it or I'll just take it off.  I looked at every 'minimalist' wallet i could find, chose this one based on description and reviews and I am very pleased with it.
Nice small wallet that feels like it will hold up over time.
Best minimal wallet I have found
Cute for those who do t like to carry bags like me
This is a cool little card holder and the strap hold everything to your phone! Neat!

Really super cute and useful product. I like everything together and this takes care of that perfectly when I am on the go and don't want my purse that everything gets lost in. I have a clutch wallet and phone and keys and this keeps it all bundled together perfectly where I don't have to find anything. Its trendy and useful together as one. Even if I do use my purse I can still use this and throw it all in there and still have everything together where I can find it easily. I have received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased reviews

I've had it about a week now and I love it. It's well made, solid, and feels like it will last forever. Literally the only problem I have with it is that it is so light and small, that when I do the "pat down" I have a miniature freak out, thinking I lost my wallet somewhere.
summary: I've had it about a week now and I love it. It's well made

reviewText: love this for all my credit cards, medical cards and store cards. I have 20 cards in it (carry cash in another "men's" magic wallet along with my more frequently used credit cards ) The two wallets make it easy to carry a small purse and change purses easily and frequently. once again why be so sexist with the label?!
summary: why is this labeled for men?!

reviewText: I like the idea behind this wallet since I'm a very minimalist when it comes to my wallet.  However I do not like how the blue band is vertical; keeping money with the wallet is the not the easiest. I personally believe they should add a smaller/thinner horiztonal band and make the current blue one smaller.  Not bad but the design is not as good as i had hoped.  I will be going back to my money clip wallet i used previously since it has a magent clasp for cash.
summary: Not bad but not what I was looking for, cash doesn't play very nicely

reviewText: Perfect wallet for minimalist.  I carry 2-3 credit cards, driver's license and gym card, along with a $20, $10, $5 and a few $1s folded over.  Very well made and elastic material and strap are great.  This replaced a leather bi-fold wallet I've been using for decades.  I always hated carrying a thick wallet in my pant pocket.  This wallet is thin enough to put in front or rear pant pocket or shirt pocket and I hardly know it's there.  I also sometimes clip it to my keys.  Super great product!

I use a slim wallet for day-to-day use and I'm not sure this one will replace it, but I like it a lot as a travel wallet. The main reason is that, while everything feels secure with the strap around it, it's a bit of a pain to get anything out of the main pocket because you have to undo the strap every time. First world problem, I know, but it is a small inconvenience if you regularly have to access anything other than your main credit card (ID for example). Also not ideal for cash after your $20 bill is turned into a $10 and three $1s in change. You can access a card from the front pocket without taking off the strap, though.

Super low-profile, straps onto my iPhone 5 well enough, and great for the essentials.

Very slim wallet, much smaller than the previous one I had (an alpine swiss with a magnetic money clip). This wallet with 8 cards in it is the same size as my old one while it's empty. It's a little inconvenient to carry cash with this wallet, but it gets the job done and I haven't had any bills fall out. I don't carry cash much anyway.

I've had the wallet for 2 months now, and it's starting to show some wear and tear. The rubber strip inside the elastic band is coming off. This doesn't seem to affect the wallet at all though, everything is still secure. What I am more concerned about is the stitching came undone around the top of the outer lining of the back pocket, and now the elastic band which holds the pocket tight against the cards is separated from the fabric, which is now noticeably loose. The wallet still holds everything thanks to the colored elastic band, but it concerns me that it's coming apart after only two months, which is why I didn't leave 4 stars. Apart from those problems this is a great minimalist wallet, maybe I just got one with some bad stitching, I'm considering buying another to replace it.
summary: Apart from those problems this is a great minimalist wallet

reviewText: I'm a horrible offender of someone who shoves too much in their wallet. This keeps me from doing that. I was trying to use a shark wallet previously and it was junk. This feels very solid and allows me to carry just what I  need. I also like being able to easily clip it inside my bag when I get to the airport, so that I know it's secured inside my bag and I haven't dropped it.
Works better than I expected super compact, feels sturdy, holds all my stuff from insurance cards, credit cards drivers license and room for cash. Highly recommended

You'll need to cut down your card carrying with this wallet, I like the product but the top loop will wear the top of your credit cards which may not be a big deal to most people.  I takes some getting used to if you come from a normal wallet with 5 or more cards.  Overall I'm satisfied with Crabby.

Absolutely love this wallet!  I have 10 cards total and it is still super thin.  The only negative is when you pull out a card, you have to slide the band over.  If you have money in the band, be careful to pull it out.  I dropped money already not paying attention to the money I had banded.

My husband was always complaining about how much he had in his wallet. I purchased this for him, and he laughed at me.  Now I laugh at him since it's now his favorite. It's compact and allows him to keep only what needs.

I have been using this wallet for about a week now and love it. I don't usually carry a lot of cash so this is perfect for the cards I carry (4 plus a few business cards).  I have tried simmilar wallets and this is by far the best one yet.  When I do have cash on me I just tuck it into the main pocket with the cards and usually have a small fold on the top of the bills.

I was previously using a binder clip for my wallet because I got really tired of carrying around the fat leather wallet. When this went on sale, I picked one up and have been extremely happy with it. Its simple, thin, and keeps everything securely together. The addition of the ring to clip something like a key on is also nice. I have been using it for about a month and it still looks brand new. If you are looking for a simple and thin wallet, this is the one to get!
summary: I picked one up and have been extremely happy with it

reviewText: Fell apart after 1 month of use. The stitching came loose on the bottom which led to the wallet unraveling and is now useless. Was a nice wallet until it broke.
summary: The stitching came loose on the bottom which led to the wallet unraveling and is now useless. Was a nice wallet until it broke

reviewText: I love this wallet.  Exactly what I wanted and expected.
I like the size and fit in the pocket, but the strap that goes around to hold card in place is falling apart after 6 weeks of use. Which means i'm stuck with a unusable wallet.

reviewText: sons loves it.

reviewText: Well designed, and does indeed force minimalism without sacrificing function.  My key loop broke within a week; the clasp snapped at the base and I nearly lost my (2) keys.  Five stars for the wallet, one for the  key loop, average three.
summary: Well designed, and does indeed force minimalism without sacrificing ...

reviewText: Works perfectly for my needs. Holds everything in securely. Stay nice and thin and lite.

reviewText: I love my crabby wallet!!  It's light,  functional and I get comments on it every time I pull it out to pay for something.  If you are a person who carries a lot of cash then this is probably not the best wallet for you,  but if you use your debit card/credit cards most of the time then look no further this wallet is for you!

reviewText:
I had a friend who got into the initial Kickstarter campaign and had a few issues with his Crabby. I'm glad I waited because this new version has been great. I always had a small wallet but wanted something easier to put in my front pockets if need be, this definitely works.

The only thing that makes me nervous is that it's TOO small and I might lose it. I'm thinking of buy one of the Bluetooth Tile gizmos to make it easier to track down.

UPDATE: so the strap that goes around the card has a bit of sticky material that keeps your card secure. Mine has now come off after only a little use. Looks like I'll have to go back to my old wallet.
summary: I'm glad I waited because this new version has been great - UPDATE: it's broken

reviewText: Great wallet for being on the go. I don't know if I would recommend this as an everyday wallet as I have too many daily items to keep in here but it works great for me when on vacation. I don't like to carry around all my cards when I am being a tourist and this wallet works great to hold a couple cards, ID, room key and some cash. It seems to expand to allow for many more cards but I like the minimalist approach when I am on the road.
summary: Not an everyday wallet but great for traveling

reviewText: Love it

Simply buy this now! About five years ago I had a large leather wallet that I kept in my back-pocket... which is the worst thing you can do for your back and posture. I tried various "Minimal" wallets over the last two years, including the hard-shell RFID ones... but the Crabby is the BEST one I have ever owned.
This is the best slim option wallet I have found yet.
Excellent for the traveling working man, doesn't allow you to collect clutter in your wallet and you hardly know it's in your pocket.
summary: Excellent for the traveling working man

reviewText: Really enjoying this new wallet. Elastic band is nice to hold cash and keep cards in. Feels really small in my pocket (forget it's there half the time). This is a really good front pocket wallet.
It is a really good wallet for your cards.....not really good for cash though
Try it. I never thought I'd get by with a minimalist wallet. But it's been a couple of weeks and I don't want to go back to the big wallet.
summary: Try it. I never thought I'd get by with ...

reviewText:
I have been using a traditional wallet for years and I used to keep it like George Costanza; overflowing with nonsense. Moving over to this wallet has been a great decision. It forces me to carry less and take action on things quicker (not stuffing it into my wallet and "get to it later").

I highly suggest this wallet!

reviewText: love it but the glue holding the rubber strip needs to be a stronger adhesive. it comes apart once you stretch a few times after you receive it

good stuff!
Light, slim, very affordable, and does it all with no problems....a great product.
Item work great for my Thumb drives however if I get on a spending kick with my credit cards I could see me adding them into this purse.

reviewText: This is my initial review (about 2 weeks in) as I'll need to see how it holds up over time. I purchased it because it covered my needs - being able to hold 5-10 cards, cash and a spare (car) key. The wallet looks good with casual attire (jeans or khakis), but I pulled it out while wearing a button down shirt and dress pants for work and it looked out of place. I should've expected that though. This replaced a larger wallet but I had to get rid of some cards to make it fit alright - which I was okay doing. Overall it's meeting my needs and I really do like it compared to what I had. I just hope it stands the test of time.

This thing is really handy, small, compact, & easy to use. I love it! The only thing I would have liked is some way to connect it to a key chain. The attachment on it doesn't seem secure enough to do that with. To bad I don't plan to use it for too long. Plan to only carry 1 card & ID on my phone once the programmable cards start hitting the market.  I also never carry cash any more.
summary: Handy, small, compact & easy to use

reviewText:
I've used the wallet for about a week and like it so far. I have a Nexus 6 so I am unable to strap the wallet to it. The only future concern I have so far is how long the elasticity will last.

I think a version with a removable band would be nice. I don't really want to cut it off in case I would like to have one in the future.

Overall though I think its one of the best minimalist wallets I've used because I can attach keys to it and stow in pocket without much bulk. The previous one I used for about 8 years.
summary: I've used the wallet for about a week and like it so far

reviewText: Really like this wallet. Not a whole lot to it, but it keeps everything I need right where I need it. Extremely slim and nothing falls out. Heck of a lot better than having a huge bifold or trifold again. Definitely a keeper.
Great little wallet

I love the Crabby Wallet. I've given two away as gifts and just bought a new one to replace my first one I received a while ago when they were first released.  I had an issue with the first one when it arrived. It had a slight defect. I contacted customer support about the defect and they replaced it right away for me. Great customer service.

The first Crabby Wallet held up just fine over heavy use. But it was looking kind of dirty and grungy. So I bought a new one in a different color. It's great.

My favorite thing about this wallet is that it holds all of my cards and cash snuggly, even when I occasionally jam a larger stack of cards or bills into it. Then when I remove the extra stuff, the wallet is still snug and not stretched out. At the same time, it is soft and comfortable in my front pocket, unlike the metal clips that I feel like they are cutting into my leg or ruining my pants.
At first the wallet doesn't look impressive, but once the wallet is locked and loaded you'll be amazed at how much stuff this wallet can hold and hold tightly.

Took it out of the package, and the lobster clasp broke.  Was looking for a solid keychain wallet, to replace my current one.  Wallet seems like it would hold up fine, just have to find something to connect my keys.
summary: Wallet seems like it would hold up fine

reviewText: Love the wallet, feels like its going to last years (I also don't plan on jamming 40 cards in it). I don't like a brick in my pocket and I take pictures of business cards with my phone so this wallet is perfect. There's two pockets, one main and the one in front. Band that goes around is sewn on so you can't lose it.

I have tried quite a few minimalist wallets.. I can easily say that this wallet is my favorite. I love the elastic band to hold all of your cards in. It is also great to store money on the outside of the wallet, as well as receipts or whatever else you carry. I cant stand big bulky wallets, and this one is an answer to my problems. I bought 2 just because if/when the first one falls apart, ill have a second one to switch over to. Great job on this!!!

Perfect wallet for me.  I have never been a fan of the George Costanza wallet, making all of my previous wallet choices slim and only capable of holding 5-7 cards max.  The other wallets I've have were always made out of leather and tended to stretch, allowing my cards to fall out too easily.  This wallet is obviously more secure with the strap but even without it, my contents stay in place very well!

Pros:
- Slim
- Secure
- Orange color looks better than what is pictured
- Kickstarter project (creator is a young man from Utah)

Cons:
- Just a tad annoying getting the lesser used cards out.  However, it was to be expected and doesn't bother me enough to strip a star.
summary: Just as advertised and loving it!

reviewText: Very disappointing.  I was probably expecting too much, but it is woefully inadequate both for a phone and for credit cards.  The cards do not really fit!
summary: Very disappointing. I was probably expecting too much, ...

reviewText: Exceeds my expectations, letting me keep my cards and cash in a tiny, credit card sized package

Small, well designed minimalist wallet. NOT for people who need to keep receipts for all their purchases, or every denomination of cash in their wallet. You have to cut down to your priorities with this (a good thing). The result is you can put this in your front pocket and not screw with your posture by sitting lopsided.

Absolutely great minimalist wallet. No more sitting lopsided during the drive, no more unnecessary clutter, no more need for a man purse ( haha ) ....get yourself one of these. Well built and easily holds 10 cards, money and a note from my daughter.

So far so good. I was carrying around a canvas, luggage ID with CC and ID which was bulkier and less useful than this thing. I love the concept and it was exactly what I was looking for. Well made and well designed.
It is everything I was looking for in a thin wallet. I don't like how long the elastic band will last pulling it off and on all the time but so far I haven't had any issues with it.
summary: I don't like how long the elastic band will last pulling it ...

reviewText: I got this wallet a little while back. I love it, and it holds my 8 cards plus a credit card size steel bottle opener. I'm never worried that my cards are going to fall out, and it beats carrying a full size wallet.
summary: I love it, and it holds my 8 cards plus ...

reviewText: Great wallet but only OK because it's missing an easy access pouch. I don't need more cards, but getting on and off the band across the top is pretty annoying. I've used it for a week and I'll give it a bit more time before ordering a "slim wallet"
summary: Not bad, but missing a feature

reviewText:
Update, after owning this for a while. I have to say that it just doesn't hold up. The rubber liner in the strap fell apart almost immediately.  Now the the ads are pulling out all over and elastic is fraying.  I'm a little bit disappointed.
It has changed my mind on minimalist wallets.  I own 3 other very expensive versions from various competitors.  This one is actually doing its job! Currently holding 9 cards and around 8 bills, it's perfect!  Easily carried in front or back pockets.  I'm an electrician,  which means 2 things,  I have extra cards that must be carried,  and I'm extremely hard on everything.  This wallet can get wet, go through the wash, or dropped in the mud without consequence.

Love my new Crabby Wallet. Fits in front pocket easily, without bulkiness. The lobster claw strap around my belt adds extra security while working.
UPDATE: Have purchase 2 and multiple claw attachments. Disappointed that the claw attachments have all broken. A heavier duty claw would be great.

I couldn't pass up the opportunity to review this innovative take on the traditional wallet.  I'm one of those guys who has carried a bifold wallet in my back pocket since forever.  However, I've definitely wanted something a bit more compact for quite some time as I almost exclusively use credit cards to pay for things these days.  I found other solutions, like money clips, to be too flashy, had no place to hide "emergency cash", and/or having a propensity to scratch up my credit cards.

I saw this item on Kickstarter quite some time ago and it caught my interest; but then in the rush of life just forgot about it until I happened upon it while browsing Amazon.  I immediately purchased and have been thoroughly satisfied!  I carry around 10 plastic cards (credit cards, driver's license, state bar membership card, etc.), a couple dollar bills, and one "emergency" bill.  Everything I need fits into the Crabby Wallet with minimal bulk!  The band keeps everything secure and having the ability to quickly attach my car key to the wallet make sure I don't lose anything.

While finding the card I'm looking for may take a bit more time than in a traditional wallet, the "quick access" pocket is convenient for my two main go-to cards.  The only way I might see improving the product is to add a "quick access" pocket to the opposite side of the product as well, but certainly that's just a personal thought which would likely increase the bulk of the product and not be desirable for everyone.  Even if your preference is to maintain a larger wallet, something like this is perfect for traveling, when you need to have means for payment but want to minimize bulk.  This is certainly an improvement on the double-looped rubber band solution I've typically used in those instances.

I'd highly recommend the product (and have already done so).  The quality of the item's construction equals the innovative nature of the concept and the reasonable price makes it a no-brainer deal.  That's something that certainly can't be said of many things these days.
summary: Fantastic product, from concept to execution!

reviewText: I bought this Crabby Gear "Men's" V2 Purple crabby wallet for myself, a woman! This is perfect for me, for in my purse and in my pocket. I keep it in my purse with my essential cards, and cash then if I want to grab and run with just the little wallet it's easy and ready to go.

reviewText: Great wallet! I've been looking to transition from my back pocket to my front pocket for a while now due to comfort issues and because my cards eventually start bending which then causes them not to work in some card readers. After reading reviews and looking at the Kickstarter it looks like version 2 is a huge improvement over the first and I will say the build quality is great. I have been carrying it for over a week now and haven't had any issues at all. It took some getting used to as I have used a bi-fold wallet for several years but I love how slim it is. The only thing I am having an issue with is where exactly to keep cash. If you fold it in half then it fits lengthwise but is taller than the cards so it mashes it down. If you fold it into quarters and put it in sideways it fits but kind of gets lost down in the wallet and is difficult to get out. I'm not taking any stars away because I know this is geared toward use with cards and I'm not one who typically has cash either but it does happen from time to time because there still are dinosaurs around my town that don't accept cards. I have just been folding it into quarters and sticking it under the elastic band on the outside. It works but I fear if I don't pay attention then I may drop it one day. I think adding another short pocket on the back for cash use wouldn't add any bulk and make it a little safer as well as more convenient to get in and out of the wallet. Regardless, it is still a great product and I look forward to any future versions that may come along. I will also note that the orange is slightly darker than the stock photo here on Amazon. I included a picture for comparison.

The V2 of the Crabby Wallet is a much needed improvement over the V1. If you are a fan of minimalist wallets, this will serve your needs well. I don't ever use the strap to attach it to my phone, but rather to hold temporary items like gift cards, movies tickes, cash, receipts, etc... The strap of the V2 is wider than the original and has a rubber lining on the underside that prevents slippage of items held within its grasp. This works well with few cards to quite a lot of cards (I have a friend who fits 10+ into his). I hope this helps.
- Heather's husband

reviewText: Item comes as shown.

I love this tacky, tacky, tacky necklace!
Generally I like very understated jewelry, plain chains, or simple pendants, but lately I have been enjoying some super tacky stuff, and this is the second necklace of this design I have bought. A different color than my first one, but just as much fun!
The clasp is a lobster claw type of closure, and fairly easy to operate. There is an extension chain, about one and one half inches long, so you can adjust the length somewhat for your most comfortable fit.
It is a heavy piece, very unlike what I am used to, but after a couple of minutes I don't really feel it anymore.
It is made mostly of metal, so you might want to avoid lightning storms hehehe.
I received this waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay cool necklace at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I bought this for my friend's birthday. It is totally right up her alley. It is very sturdy! The chain feels on the lighter side for as big as it is, so I would guess it is made of cheaper, lighter alloys. (Not a bad thing! Cause this thing does have some heft to it anyway.) The flowers are made of metal and the beads have a glass like look but upon feeling them I think they are acrylic. The larger of the flowers, the paint from the inner bead(?) or something stained the innards of the flower blue. Doesn't look intentional but doesn't detract in any way. The ribbon weaved into the chain is held together by heat sealing the ends. You can see that when you look close enough. It does have an adjustable chain (with a cute "diamond" charm). In the photos, I have it clasped on the shortest length. Still not bad at all for a costume necklace. I have certainly bought things that have felt much cheaper and of lower quality. Overall, I am pretty satisfied with this product! I would definitely recommend. In fact I am giving it as a gift and it has definitely passed the test.
*I received this item at a discount for my honest/unbiased review.*

reviewText:
I really dig unique jewelry. That being said I am quite finicky when it comes to jewelry as well. I look for quality workmanship on top of it being unlike anything else I have seen before. I like my jewelry to be wearable art. This necklace fits all the items on y checklist and then some. Who doesn't want a cool rib cage around their neck? It sure is one heck of a conversation starter! From the clasp, to the ribcage itself this necklace will last a very long time. I've worn it everyday since I received it just to see if it would turn my neck green, cause a rash or whatnot...nothing! YAY! I have received many compliments from young hipsters to older rock and rollers alike, the necklace caught their eye and moved them enough to compliment a total stranger on it. As I said it is very well made but it isn't heavy or bulky. I've worn this necklace with my rattiest old concert T-shirt to wearing it as business casual. It provides me that extra stand out factor.
I have to mention packaging here....and I have reviewed a lot of items...this seller goes the extra mile. It came packaged in a standard zip loc like closure small jewelry bag. However, that was within a gauzy purple pouch with a handwritten Thank You note on it. To me, it is the extra little touches a seller is willing to go, to ensure a repeat customer and to personalize the whole online shopping experience. A+ start to finish! I couldn't be more pleased with my very cool necklace. I did receive this item at a slight discount in exchange for my honest review. Obviously I am very impressed with this seller, and the necklace alike. I wish there were more merchants on Amazon like this.

reviewText: Such a pretty necklace!

Wow this is a beautiful pendant. I have had many compliments when I wear it.  It is quite unusual and draws a lot of attention to itself.  The stone is the exact color show in the ad and it floats nicely just below chocked level on my neck.  The package arrived on time and was well padded.  I will buy from this company again

I go this at a reduced cost I exchange for an unbiased opinion.

I love this necklace because it is so unique in both color and design! The material (as pictured) is a nice bronze-gold, and doesn't feel too cheap, not like it will rub off immediately. I love that the chain is a bit thicker than usual, and therefore the "lobster claw" closure is also quite large, making it super easy to handle - no more fumbling to undo your necklace! This would be great if (like me) you struggle with tiny, dainty jewelry clasps.

The charm is clearly printed on the front with the adorable hedgehog design, while the back side is plain textured metal. While wearing it around for a couple of hours, I didn't notice any flipping - the weighting seems solid enough to prevent this - so the unprinted backside shouldn't be a problem.

As a bonus, the necklace came with a cute drawstring "Jane Stone" pouch, perfect for gifting, storing, or stashing other small jewelry items.

My only criticism (if any) is that you cannot adjust the length of this necklace - it only has one large ring for the claw closure, no extender - but the pendant sits at a nice position anyway so this is not a major issue. (See photos for a length on me.) The hedgie does hang rather close to my cleavage, however, which is not ideal for more modest dressing styles. This necklace would probably look best with either a low-cut or high-cut neckline - "in between" would cause the pendant to get jumbled up with your shirt.

In the interest of full disclosure, I did receive this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review. I am in no way rewarded for writing a positive review; these thoughts are 100% my own and would not be any different if I had paid full price.

As much as I love this necklace, I think I will be gifting it to my hedgehog-obsessed mum for Mother's Day :)

When I ordered this necklace, I was not aware of the level of detail that has been given to the design. The gold chain has fabric woven in it, there are sparkles and flowers everywhere, and something new to notice with almost every look at this necklace.

Pros:
-cute, especially if you like flowers and can pull off the bib-necklace style
- surprisingly lightweight; from looking at it, you'd expect this necklace to leave you with an injury, but that is not the case
-The combo of pink, green, and gold makes this easy to fit into most wardrobes
-the design and style make it a piece that could be worn by many types of people- from classic to grunge

Cons:
-It took a long time to arrive because it was mailed from China
-the flexibility of the movable parts (flowers, leaves, stars, etc.) can make it hard to see all the detail (I received several comments about this)
-the chain is massive! I think it's cute, but someone could easily receive comments from people about the sheer size of the chain the design is on
-The clasp is solid, but doesn't look like it will last long when compared to similar necklaces (again, the massive design chain looks like it might be too heavy for the clasp to last on this piece).
-the metal flower petals could cut you or anyone who attempts to grab at this necklace without paying careful attention to what they are doing. They are not super sharp, but I could easily see my 12 year-old niece cutting herself on it.

Overall- I give it 4 stars, taking one star for delivery time and the over-flexibility of the movable parts

Full Disclosure: I have received this item at a discount in exchange for my unbiased review.

love my necklace! It is not heavy to wear. Everywhere I go, I get compliments on it!!

I have a friend who loves hedgehogs, so I am on the lookout for cute little talismans she may add to her collection. This necklace appeared to be fairly priced. It arrived on time through Amazon Prime and is pretty close to what I expected.

The charm and the chain are made of a golden, bronzy metal. The charm is a bit hefty, so the chain is not dainty. I will consider re-stringing the necklace with a thinner but durable chain to increase the overall aesthetic of the necklace. Its not that I dislike the chain, its just that I think another chain would be better for me personally if I were to wear this often. A slimmer chain would be more sleek and draw attention to the hedgehog charm better.

The charm is reasonably well made, for the price. The front has the hedgehog details whereas the back does not, as you can see in the photos I included. I like this, however, and when you wear the necklace as long as the hedgehog side is facing out the pendant does not flip around on your chest and hangs true. The charm is slightly convex so that the hedgehog pops out and looks more three-dimensional.

I must comment on how adorably the item is packaged, as well. The necklace came well protected in bubble wrap with a cute Thank You sticker affixed to the top. It also came with a nice sachet in which you can store the necklace, other necklaces, or use as part of your gift wrapping. I intend to give this item away as a gift, so the bonus of the sachet is really nice.

If you receive the item and decide you do not like to wear it, the hedgehog charm could definitely be repurposed. I thought about converting him into a cell phone charm or adding him to a keychain. I do believe the charm is durable enough to be affixed to a cell phone or keychain, which would definitely put more stress on the metal than simply wearing it as a necklace.

Bottom line: This is a reasonably priced, cute necklace that is worthwhile for someone who would really like the hedgehog charm. It comes packaged well and would make a great gift.

I received this item at a discount in exchange for my fair and honest review. Thank you seller!
summary: Adorable charm, has many uses if you don't wish to use as a necklace

When I received it it was more beautiful than I'd imagined. It's large, as I'd expected from the pictures, but it was in no way uncomfortable or too heavy. reviewText: This ribcage necklace is SO. FREAKIN. CUTE. I was worried the charm/pendant would be too small to be very noticeable, but it is the perfect size. Not too big & not too small. Another plus is that it's cute on both and front and back of the cage, so when it inevitably gets turned around while on my neck (all pendant-necklaces do!), it won't matter. The chain it comes on is adjustable too, woot! Never know when I'll need a different length depending on my outfit. The silver has that "vintage burn" look to give a bit of an antique feel, which I love. Gah, this necklace is so detailed and unique... I can't wait to wear it to a party and start racking up the compliments!!!

This is a really cute necklace. The rib cage bigger than I thought it would be- about 1 1/2 in.  The clasp is easy to open and close, the necklace hangs at the right length (not in my cleavage, and not choking me!), and it is comfortable to wear (not too heavy, the chain doesn't catch on anything, etc.). The picture on the product page is a bit brighter and shinier than the actual necklace, but I think the darker, grungier look is more appropriate.  I'll be ordering another rib cage necklace for a friend. Great find for people with a darker sense of humor.

reviewText: I actually got this for my girlfriend who is definitely a huge harry potter fan and she thought it was very cool.  While I am not a fan of the character, books or movies I do think this is a pretty cool design and can at least appreciate it for that.  And it is actually surprisingly well made too.  It is a lot more solid and sturdy than I thought it would be, it does not feel cheap, it does not feel like it is going to break or anything, the metal feels strong.  I even tried bending it a little and it held up.  (Granted, I did not try too hard, but some effort was made)  The chain has two different links so that it can hang at two different lengths depending on preference.  My girlfriend did mention that she wished it was a little longer, but I imagine that is a matter of preference.  And the actual pendant does hang like it does in the picture, which you may notice, is upside down.  (The lightning bolt scar that Harry Potter has is not on his cheek under his glasses, but rather on his fore head ABOVE his glasses)  You can flip it up the right way and it will hold there for a little while, but moving around will cause it to flip back upside down like it is in the main picture.  Which is still clearly a recognizable Harry Potter design.  I did receive this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I like the necklace and Rib Cage pendant. The rib cage is actually larger than I expected ( maybe 1.5") so that was a nice surprise! It seems like it will hold up for a long time , it is pretty sturdy, I squeezed it a little to see if there was any give and it didn't budge..that's a PLUS! Oh, and it really does look like a rib cage!
The chain is pretty basic.. it is about a 16" link chain. The links are definitely thick and strong enough to hold the pendant though and the coloring matches the pendant perfectly. It also has a little extender chain so you can choose the length you want so you can do either  16' or 18'.
There are 11 ribs on each side , front and back if you are curious. There is a wide opening at the bottom so if you wanted to be creative and add something like a red stone to look like a heart you actually could!
If you are looking for something sterling silver, then this is not your piece but, if you want something fun and different and for the price THIS IS IT!!
If you are like me and you enjoy wearing  the different odd, eclectic things you will like this necklace!
I bought it because it reminded me of the Walking Dead since it is a skeleton rib cage!

When I received this necklace/pendant ten-days ago I was dazzled by the shimmering finish on this piece of jewelry.  The PearlessPlus Womens Vintage Round Glasses Necklace Z Scar Pendant is a beautiful piece of jewelry!  I love the silver finish and how it shimmers in the light.  It truly mesmerized me upon opening the plastic pouch it was shipped in. In truth, I was not expecting a pendant quite so beautiful for the price I paid.  The necklace is not of high quality.  The Necklace is made of alloy, and is lightweight, considering the size of chain, but it is designed in a fashionable pattern, has a nice working lobster claw clasp, comes with an extendable chain, and has a beautiful silver finish.  I can see the necklace lasting for quite some time providing it is handled with care.  The Z Scar Pendant is made of Resin with a silver finish.  Take care not to clean the pendant in water, or jewelry cleaner, but wipe clean using a dry cloth, and avoid direct sunlight.  The pendant is breakable.  The necklace and pendant makes a great gift for Harry Potter fans.  And all avid Harry Potter book readers.  I purchased this necklace and pendant for my daughter who has read every Harry Potter book ever written, and watched every movie made.  I know she will be as thrill to receive this necklace and pendant as I was to open the package for the first time.  I find this to be a reasonably priced item, and although not the best made piece of jewelry, a piece of jewelry that a collector will cherish and take care of, and welcome into their collection.
I have been reviewing the PearlessPlus Womens Vintage Round Glasses Necklace Z Scar Pendant Jewelry Gifts for Friends for amzreviewtrader in exchange for a discount toward my purchase of this product, and my honest, and unbiased review.
summary: Fantastic Necklace/Pendant for "Harry Potter" Fans and Collectors.  I love this piece of jewelry.

reviewText: Looks real.  Great veining, beautiful, not a piece of junk and the price is great.

So tickled by this hedgehog pendant necklace. It is just adorable!

Mr. Hedgehog and his chain are a faux antique gold. The color is one of the best for wearing an "unknown metal." Because I am sensitive to most metals, I did spray this entire necklace with a clear spray coat before wearing it. (If you don't have skin sensitivities, just be careful not to get this necklace wet and carry on.)

The chain can be adjusted in length up to 21", a feature rarely found in jewelry in this price category.

Mr. Hedgehog's metal work isn't perfect; he has some dings already. They aren't noticeable to me as the wearer, but it you examine him carefully, they're evident.

Even though he's made out of mystery metal and not perfection on a chain, I recommend this fashion hedgehog pendant to most. If you're clear (which you should be from the price) that you're buying fashion jewelry, you'll love this little guy.

I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for writing this honest and unbiased review.

I purchased this necklace as a gift for my sister who is a nurse, and she loves it :) It is made of solid, lightweight metal (I'd guess some type of alloy) and has an antiqued finish. The pendant is about the size of a US dollar coin and maybe half an inch thick. Inside the cage is hollow. The pendant and chain are attached by a silver metal loop at the top of the pendant. The chain is made of the same color antiqued metal as the pendant. When latched on the main clasp, the necklace rests just below my collarbone. The length is slightly adjustable if you use the extended chain (see photo). It all came packaged in a pretty tulle ouch with a drawstring. This appears to be a quality item that should hold up well.

Shipping was veeeeeeery slow, but did arrive in the estimated time frame (3-4 weeks).

I received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This necklace is very creative and a wonderful addition to a Harry Potter fan's collection! The necklace arrive on time and was very well packaged. One of the first things I noticed is that a cute gift bag was included with the  necklace. I wasn't expecting this, but it was a pleasant surprise. I'm keeping the necklace for myself, but the bag would make it easy to gift to a friend that loves the series as much as I do.

The glasses charm is larger than I expected, probably 2 inches across.  I was expecting something small and dainty, but these are large and in charge. There is no hiding your fandom while wearing is necklace. Too bad there aren't any more movies coming out......

I was pleased that this necklace did not have an offending smell when I opened it. Recently, items I have order that come from overseas have been having a terrible smell on them when they arrive and I have to wash the item first before wearing it. I'm glad this one came ready to wear straight out of the package.

The chain is sturdy and very shiny, with an adjustable length depending on where you clasp it. All in all this is a wonderful accessory and a welcome addition to any true fan's wardrobe.

I was given an discount on this product to provide an honest and unbiased review.

Wow, did I stumble on the most interesting statement necklace ever!  I love that this necklace has a cluster of different sized skulls.  The skulls actually look really cute because if you look closely, the are smiling. :)  The piece looks so classy but with a hard edge because they are skulls.  There is a mixture between feminine and hard which is a great juxtaposition.  I love jewelry that makes that kind of a statement.  The necklace always solicits a compliment every time I put it on.  If you are not afraid of loud statement necklaces, this is a great piece to add to your collection.  The length is 17.72" plus an additional 2.75" of extension so you can really adjust it to your liking.  The necklace weighs in at 215 grams which is about a 1/2 pound.  It's a pretty substantial piece of jewelry.  This is a great gift for someone who loves larger jewelry pieces.  It comes with a see through mesh drawstring pouch great for safekeeping and packing for travel.  I bought this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I love it! It's whimsical and unusual. I like that all scull pieces are different, depending on their position in the necklace, i.e., there are front view and side view, and left and right view pieces - exciting! The little crystals (purple, in my case), in combination with gold, give a nice mysterious sheen, not overpowering. Even though I like the theme, I wouldn't probably wear it as an everyday necklace - there has to be a special occasion for it, like a costume party or some special dance night, or, I don't know, a movie maybe. Also, it's quite heavy visually (not so much physically), so I'd make sure it's a centerpiece of my outfit. In other words, it's a nice surprise piece to have in my jewelry collection.

reviewText:
This necklace is gorgeous. My daughter was with me when I unwrapped it. We looked at each other & agreed it's much better quality than we expected.

It arrived a week earlier than the estimated delivery date, which was a nice surprise. So it took about three weeks total from the date I ordered to arrive.

I had ordered three separate pieces on the same day from this same seller, Pearl Plus, paying shipping X3 and so I contacted them and asked if they could combine shipping and to my surprise, they obliged very happily and refunded my account for shipping X2. They replied very promptly and very courteously to my email. I'm very pleased with their customer service.

Now, as for the necklace, itself, it is a bib necklace with three rows of 23 cascading rhinestone encrusted skulls. And one skull hangs from the back of the necklace as shown in the picture when you order. I chose to order the purple rhinestone with gold hardware. Silver was not an option for me at the time, but I will be purchasing this necklace in silver.

It's a really beautiful piece, much more so in person. The pictures don't quite capture the sparkle. If you love all that glitters, or looking for the perfect gift for that special Libra in your life, look no further. She'll love it.

This product was offered to me at a discount in exchange for my honest review.
summary: The pictures do not do this necklace Justice. It's gorgeous.

An iPhone 6 case with thin 'emergency' reading glasses built in! For those of us who only need glasses for reading, this is a handy product. Say you are going out for a while, maybe to get a coffee. You have your phone but if you receive a message while there, you have to squint to read it. With this case on your phone, you pop on the glasses momentarily so can see your phone massage clearly and afterward, put it away with the glasses stored safely in the case.
These glasses are just for occasional 'emergency' use as they perch on the bridge of your nose with a springy pinch. Remember the old pince-nez glasses from decades ago? The fit is comfortable but wearing them is no fashion statement.
This clever case with built-in reading glasses is worth consideration for those of us who need a little close-up help.
summary: An iPhone 6 case with built-in glasses - clever!

reviewText:
This review is for the iPhone case. I'm a fan of the ThinOPTICS glasses and have several pair because they are super convenient.

I purchased two T/O iPhone cases. Regrettably, both are inadequate for protecting the corners and top/bottom edges of the iPhones. I contacted ThinOptics regarding my concern. Kristian from T/O replied via email, "This is a suggestion I have heard before and our design team is aware of this request, though at this time have no plans to make this change."

Until the T/O iPhone case is updated, I suggest purchasing their universal "Stick Anywhere" case and apply it to the back of your own iPhone case.
summary: 1 Star iPhone Case / 5 Stars for Glasses

reviewText:
I have had this product for 1 year. It is truly convenient, cures frustration from needing to borrow someone's glasses to read a menu, etc.
I would buy it again. So, that's the compliment part of my experience. In the year that I've had it, I have fixed it with crazy glue a total of 3 times (the bridge over the nose). I can't fix them any more, so I will wait for my next phone (2.5 weeks from now) and re-buy the glasses / case.
I wish that the manufacturer could engineer a better way of attaching the glasses to the flexible bridge, something like titanium or kevlar. The design is really flimsy, any designer can look at a brand-new unit and say "that's going to break, sooner than you think". I am NOT an abuser. I "baby" these glasses when removing-from and replacing them in the case, and I really only need it for menus and texts, and that's not as much as my other psycho-phone-friends. The company and product are admirable. They don't have competition. Yet. Thanks, and thanks to ThinOptics.
summary: I wish that the manufacturer could engineer a better way of attaching the glasses to the flexible bridge

reviewText: It is very useful

Background - As I age my "smartphone" screen  and restaurant menus seem to be shrinking. I have bought many "Cheaters" from Drug Stores, but it seemed like they were always at my desk, in my car, or in my computer bag when I needed them most. I wanted something I could keep with my phone since my phone is always with me (demands of my job).

Selection Process - There are other small cheaters available, but I liked what I saw in therms of a case and holder. I was worried about some of the reviews, but wanted to give a small company a chance to earn my loyalty. So far they have and I have found most of the negative things said not to be true.

Out of the Box - Everything was there and in good condition. There was a paper included that offered a lifetime warranty in exchange for web registration. I made immediate use of this since I am known to loose these forms or forget to register.

Registration - Fast and easy. I registered online an month ago and, to date, no spam mail from the company or anyone else (as far as I can tell).

Assembly - The included case stuck, and has remained stuck, to the back of my Otter Box  for a month now. Install was easy. If you can use a Post-It Note, you can do this.

Use - After a month, I can not complain. I have used it a lot and can see no damage or other quality issue so far! I read reviews on breaking quickly, but that has not been my experience.

Style - What style? This is why I would deduct a 1/2 Star. My kids love to tease me about them, calling me "Gram-pa Joe" (even though my name is not Joe). But they are not designed for the fashion parade, they are for short time use.

Comfort and Fit - I am tall and my nose is proportional to my body and face. I am not fat, but I am a big guy at 6'4". Since you need a nose to grip on for use, my nose structure has been optimal for use with this product. I would imagine that different noses would have different experiences. The nose bridge is made of a grippy material with a rough feel. This has not bothered me, but I did notice it the first few uses. Again, since I am using them for short term use, not reading a novel, the sandpaper feel was not an issue.

Use - They have worked great for me for short term use. I mostly use them to check emails or order from a menu. For these uses, it has been a good product.

Warranty - Lifetime free replacement. Hard to beat that!!!

Recommendation - I would recommend these as a second pair of cheaters for short term use.

I find the case a bit thin and doesn't seem like it protrudes over the front as much as my normal case.  Consequently, not sure how well it would protect the face, so may go back to my normal case and carry the glasses separately.  That said it's a thin, light case and does keep the reading glasses in an readily handy place.
summary: Convenient for holding glasses, light case, but not sure how much protection the case provides.

reviewText:
I thought this product was a brilliant idea. I still do...but it needs some improvement.

If your nose gets oily throughout the course of the day, the glasses tend to slip off while trying to use them. I learned to adjust, but it can be a nuisance if using them outdoors...in the heat.

If you carry your phone in your pocket, as I do, the glasses want to pop out of their compartment. I ended up picking my glasses up off the ground more than using them.

The case...it provides no protection. It just holds the glasses. (First broken screen from a drop...ever) For that reason, I don't use the case anymore..so I don't keep my 'cheaters' with me all the time as was the plan.

Fix the case issue, or come up with something that attaches to a Lifeproof or OtterBox case and the stars will go up.

Again, brilliant idea...just needs a few tweaks.
summary: Brilliant concept...just not quite there yet.

reviewText:
Get both the case and the glasses because these glasses are so thin and light that you can break them if they are not protected. And the case is so thin and light that it is worth it. Sure you can put them in a regular eye glass case but wouldn't that moot the point of having something like this to be easily carried? The glasses are really thin and  flexible and they squeeze into the case. The case measures 3 1/4 L, 2 W, 3/16 D and made of hard plastic in case you want to mount it to the back of your cellphone. You can either leave the case as is or stick it to the back of your cellphone with an adhesive strip that is provided. Surface shouldn't be silicone, rubber or textured. Pretty much covers most phones out there with cases. Might have to purchase some other compatible double sided tape to make it work if you wanted to mount it.

The glasses measure 4 5/16 from end to end and 4 1/2 inches fully opened. And each individual lens measures 1 x 1 3/4 inches. There is no front or back so either side works. There is no one sweet spot on the lens so the whole lens is functional. My head is on the bigger side and the lenses line up pretty good for me. The nose pads are rough like sandpaper to provide grip. You wear it for a while you will feel it a little but not bad. You are supposed to grip each lens and place it on your nose instead of pushing it down on the middle of the glasses. The fit and placement will vary with each user based on the shape of the shape and size of their nose bridge. Some may be able to sit it higher up on their nose where it is the most efficient where others it may only work lower on the nose where the bridge meets where the bulge of the nostrils start. If it sits lower then you will have to move your head up and down more or have your head held up higher depending on the level of the object you are looking at. Also if you have an oily face, it will affect how it stays on also, so wipe the bridge of your nose first helps. I would still use my regular reading glasses at home because I can just slide them down out of the way and walk around rather than removing these and placing them back on my nose every time I wanted to get up for something. And I wouldn't wear them to do something where I am constantly moving my head or where they can drop down let's say the engine compartment of my car while I was working on an engine. So great for sitting or lounging around but not for being active.

They work great and now I will carry them when I go out and able to see the menu or something. I never carried my regular reading glasses when I go out because it would be too bulky with a case. And for a female that carries a tiny purse, this is a space saver.  I wanted to give it 4 stars because I wished the nose pads would have a better fit so it could fit higher up on my nose but it's still pretty good and I can't fault them for that. If you have a flat nose then these may not work for you.
The way I wanted it! Very handy
Excellent.  Delivers as promised. The glasses take a few minutes to get used to, but then they work great. Easy to carry rather than a pair of glasses. i would buy again if I needed to.

reviewText: Used these to stretch my ears. No issues.

The tapers are ok, but you should really use stainless steel. Acrylic can harbor bacteria, using these lead to an infection for me.

The plugs are useless to be because they are too short -- when I put them on they squeeze my ear lobe and create a kind of seal that doesn't allow the skin to breath at all. Because of this, it creates conditions for redness and swelling and does not promote healing of the newly stretched tissue. Finally, the theads on the plugs (that's how the cap fits on the plugs to keep it in place) will grab/tear the ear lobe on the way through so it makes the wound worse right after stretching.

Would not buy again, and I actually just bought a set of stainless steel tapers and plugs (different design on the plugs to avoid the squeezing previously mentioned). 2 stars because the tapers themselves aren't terrible and they come in nicely labeled bags.

These are prettt good, make sure you know your conversion because they come in MM. The gauges are super lightweight which is perfect to avoid putting too much stress on your Newley gauged ears. The only downside is that the tapers are EXTREMELY long. They are not comfortable to keep in while your ears are healing because they get caught on everything or tickle/poke the side of your neck. The actual gauges themselves also are not true to size they actually are a little bigger than the gauge sizes because of the threaded ends and are very short so if your earlobes are swollen or just have a little meat on them count on these leaving a mark from being so tight. So really unless you've had your ears gauges for a while don't count on getting the gauges themself in your ears without damaging it from trying to push it through. They also are VERY iridescent which you can't really tell in the picture. The print for the black set looks white and black but they are actually pearl with purple spots which you can see when any light hits them it's also a clear plasticy coating on them which looks like over time will wear down and strip off but I haven't had that issue yet.

Awesome set to use for stretching. When you're only staying at a size for a few weeks, there's no point in spending a lot of money on them. They all come in individual zipper baggies with the sizes on them. The tapers have a nice long "at-size" section so you have some room to wiggle them around without pushing them all the way through. The tunnels are just cheap looking plastic with kind of a shiny coating on them. They're much much more blue and "plasticy" than the picture shows and the "colorful plating" is barely noticeable and starts to wear off in a few days. Now, all that being said, they are still a great buy for sizing up as long as you're not expecting anything fancy and realize that you're totally getting what you pay for.

A normal bra and panties can be worn with this out, but the outfit is not see through at all, in fact, the material is a good weight. I think this jumpsuit was designed very well and would buy it again if I had to!

Very very true to size, the size menu dropped me in the medium category; I purchased a medium & it fit just right, although the bottoms were just a TAD bit loose but it's okay because I have the bottom for it, I actually like the extra room in them, they don't sag but they are not so tight which is perfectly comfortable for me.

COLOR: I have been seeing many customers give bad rates for color, saying it's grey instead of black. WHICH IS NOT TRUE. It is indeed black but if stretched it will look as though it is grey. People who have ordered the outfit & had it turn out grey ordered a size too small, when they should have ordered a size up for their original size.

I am a model & just so happen to be at home alone the day I received the package that explains why the picture on the right was very blurry, my lens would not focus because I had to set a timer. So I sharpened it as high as the editor would let me to strengthen the outlines of my figure for you all to see how well the clothes fit me. The loose part I was referring to earlier is visible, you can kind of see below my belly button it looks loose but as I mentioned before, it didn't bother me.

SHIPPING: I was expecting to get it by the end of may but it only took TWO WEEKS to arrive!!! Awesome shipping! I was very stunned, pleased & at ease because I was leaving for NYC, ATL & Alabama on 4/29/2015, I would have not been back for awhile. That was the whole reason I had bought the outfit to begin with. I would order from the company again if I find interest in other products provided by them. Awesome, awesome, awesome!

And the material is sooo soft.  I wish I had ordered two sizes up (I ordered 8T, following reviewers recommendation of one size up) but I think that's on me.  Apparently, I am refusing to process how long my 7 year old's legs have gotten. No pockets, but nothing's 100% perfect. I will definitely be shopping this brand again.  At the price ($12.99), stop reading and just buy it already.
