I love this thing!

I purchased one for my brother because, like me, he keeps losing his stays.  Eventually I'll have to get one myself but for now I'm stocked up as I made liberal use of it before wrapping it back up :D

It really does work like a hole punch but requires just a tad more effort depending on what you're punching from.  Also watch out 'cause they come flying up at you instead of down like other punches.  I used an old credit card and some rewards cards I never used, managing to get 6 stays out of each.  The edges are just a hair rough but can either be filed with a fingernail file or left as-is.  They weren't rough enough to cut the material on the shirts so no worries about leaving as-is but I'm also not using delicate materials like silk or have expensive shirts.  Then again, if I were willing to put forward the money for expensive shirts I'd get expensive stays.

In the future I'd love to see some punch cards sized for this like they do for the pick punch.  I know I can use those but they're sized wrong so I'd have to go lengthwise and that just makes me cringe.  Still, if you lose or need collar stays, don't get new ones.  Get this instead and keep making your own!  If you have co-workers that constantly lose theirs, toss a bunch into a box at your desk and start selling them cheap!

This works great.  My son had asked for personalized collar stays for his birthday.  We sent this and some different plastics for him to cut up.  He LOVED it!!!  Of course before mailing it, we had to make a bunch just to play with making different ones.

reviewText: Well worth the money, easy biness

I LOVE the Pick Punch brand and concept. I work in a restaurant and recycle hundreds of used gift cards each month. I was really excited to have something other than guitar picks to make, but the design of this is so bad.
It pops the stays out the top, and for me it jams a lot more since its fighting gravity and I get a messed up piece. But the worst part is the puncher has a HARD EDGE right in the middle of it. About 1/4 of the stays I've punched have broken in half at that point. ALL of them have a slight crease there.  Why would they make that there?  Every other punch has a smooth curve.  It's still totally usable.  You can bend the stays back and they'll be fine.  For someone like me who uses them for crafts, having them all bent is a deal breaker.
I'm going to contact them now in case I somehow received a defective model, but I'm pretty sure it's just the design.

UPDATE:  Yup!  As an eager early adopter, I got an early model.  It has since been fixed.  GREAT customer service.  They sent me a replacement after a pleasant conversation about it.  The new design is great and clean.
summary: Hope they fix the design UPDATE:  Fixed!

Perfect bifold wallet inserts. Round corners, two tabs to slip in and hold it secure. Bottom openings to easily remove and insert cards. Clear, soft material. My old Perlina bifold wallet just does close with this insert. These cards were nicely wrapped, with a nice thank you card taped to the outside wrapper. What a nice touch! They were delivered on time. I don't know what women's wallet makers are thinking when they have so few card slots. I have 5 health insurance cards, 6 preferred customer cards, one credit card, one debit card, and one bank card. For traveling I have a driver's license, insurance card, 3 frequent flyer cards, auto rental club card, GOES card. Then I have my miscellaneous cards like library card, AARP, voter card, etc. I now have all my cards organized, visible, and easy to get to. Thank you so much for this card holder. To you it may be a small thing, but they have literally changed my world. No more taking up precious time hunting through my cards in check-out lines, doctors' offices, airline check in, etc. I also have some extra slots where I can slip my hotel room card when traveling.

Both inserts are housed in a Chic Sparrow Nano traveler's notebook and actively used as a wallet.  I need about 40 card slots for what I carry and these inserts are PERFECT!

This insert is great!  I was concerned about size but it fit into my wallet just fine, is stable and seems like a sturdier plastic than my old one had been. Beware that the insert on this is on both sides, so while the picture looks like it's flipped open, in reality this is it's natural position as there is a thick insert roughly the same size (slightly smaller) than the "flipped open" picture. The seam doesn't look thick enough to cut and divide in two. In the case of my wallet I had a flap with insert over the slot where I wanted to put this in, so I simply stuck one side of the insert in the pocket and the other side I trimmed slightly to slide into the flap covering it and then creased it down the center to try and get it to lay flat. It bulges just a little but not bad and seems to work. Makes for a fat wallet, but I had a lot of cards in there. The plastic does seem to be of good quality and design, certainly thicker than what I had in there and have been using for several years now. The pockets aren't super tight either so I believe I can get cards in and out without tearing the pockets and I do believe one pocket would hold two cards. The cards slide in along the long edge, not the short edge.
summary: If you can handle a top and bottom insert when folded up, this is for you.

It's a great leather wallet and has stood up well, but needed the photo/credit card holder finally replaced.  I found this exactly what I needed, just needed to spear an additional little hole where one of the holder pins would insert to secure the insert into the center of my wallet. Easily done with an awl.  The additional aspect I like is that each card slot is isolated from its neighbor, so no mag strips are next to each other when the credit cards are all placed in the insert.  I was always having to turn cards around just to keep those strips separated.  I was very glad to have found this wallet insert.
summary: It's a great leather wallet and has stood up well

reviewText: I bought a bunch of these for a 7-year olds birthday party. The girls LOVED them. Advice to anyone buying these. If you take them on and off all the time or pull on them, THEY WILL STRETCH OUT. If you want to keep them as a snug chocker, the best thing to do is to put the chocker on carefully without rolling the necklace (or it won't lay flat) and leave it on. The girls have been wearing the chokers 24/7 -- even during swim lessons. Those that have been worn for about a year started to fade but they weren't all stretched out like those that were taken on and off all the time.  Do be careful if you're combing long hair because your brush can accidently catch the choker and stretch it out.

reviewText: I have been doing waist training for a few years and this is the first corset I purchased from szlingerie I have a long torso and a lot of natural curve. I still have a good few inches to cinch before the corset is fully closed. This measurement is good enough for me to begin training to a smaller size. This corset is beautiful and the quality is outstanding. 20 flexible spiral steel bones and 6 rigid steel bones make this comfortably stiff yet movable. I will definitely recommend this product for anyone interested in waist training.

I love it! It fits great and would of been perfect if I would of done one more measurement and that is the measurement of my torso. I have a short torso but I thought because I have huge hips that I would need this long torso corset but I was wrong. I am 5' 145lbs  32in waist and 42in hips my torso measures 12in. I am also very flat chested so this corset almost covers my chest and the point at the bottom of the corset pokes my private part when I sit down. Totally my fault not the company. I will purchase the short torso corset soon.
summary: Great quality!!! But do your research before you buy any corset waist trainer

reviewText: This set is so cute. I wore it at the hospital and still do. I'm 6 weeks postpartum and still love this set. My baby still fits the gown too!

I bought this set to have in the hospital post-delivery.  This is an exceptionally soft set of pajamas. I love the softness- especially for the baby nightgown.  I also really liked that the print is simple (navy stripe) and not over the top with butterflies, hearts, or some other cheesy nonsense.
As for the fit- I find the pants are just a little short for me- I'm 5'7, with fairly long legs and ordered the medium.  The sleeveless top is a bit large, but I'm happy that its a bit blouse-y right now, because I've still got a bit of baby weight!  It does work very well for nursing.  If you end up with the white tank (as i did), you might want to wear a sleeping/nursing bra underneath if you're modest. (it doesn't leave much to the imagination)
The pants are great- even if you've had a c-section.  I had trouble finding any of my pants that weren't uncomfortable post surgery and these were one of the few that worked. Everyone will tell you to wear nightgowns/dresses, etc post surgery and not to wear pants- but my legs get cold!  I needed pants!
All in all- pleased with my purchase and would recommend to anyone to purchase as a gift for a new mommy (for for yourself, as I did!)
summary: Exceptionally soft PJs for new mommy and baby

Most on anazon start at S which is a 4/6. I am usually a 0/2 and I have only put on 20 pounds for this pregnancy (37 weeks pregnant at present) and currently weigh 150 at 5'4". Length on pants and robe is good. Definitely will need a nursing bra under the top. Matching baby gown is cute. reviewText: I don't usually write reviews but I absolutely had to after receiving this set. I was very skeptical because of other reviews, I am so glad I took the chance and purchased this pajama set. First it's beautiful, from the soft silky material, to the lovely colors (sea foam). The size was also spot on. I was concerned about the top being see through and also too low cut, due to negative reviews and the top was neither see through and not low cut in a way that would makes hospital visitors uncomfortable. I also adore the matching sleep sack and can not wait to put my little one in it, when he arrives. I am super stoked about this set!
This was given as a gift and she loved it.  Even bought another one in a different color.

Very comfortable but price is too high for something that is now put together very well. The sewing isn't great and I returned two of these before getting a third one. The first two looked like the sewing was coming undone in places I'll attach a picture. I really have to say though that I loved how soft and comfortable it is and I kept it even though I felt the price is way higher than it should be for the quality. It's too bad that this couldn't be cheaper if only because the sewing quality is bad and will probably not last long unless hand washed.
summary: Sewing is bad. Poor quality for price but very comfortable.

reviewText: This pajama set is amazing! True to size chart, the fabric is so incredibly soft, and the loose elastic in the waistline will be perfect for recovering from my c section. I didn't want to take these PJs off, that's how comfortable they are...plus the matching infant gown is so precious! I can't wait to wear these in the hospital. Thank you Everly Grey for making such a nice quality maternity And nursing set!

reviewText: I've loved this set. I felt it was a little pricey but I'm glad I got it. I'm 5'9 and got a large and I love the length of the bottoms. It's been a great all season set and I've loved matching my little one.
Very nice, the mom is very happy with the product.

The softest pajama set I have ever owned. I cannot wait to wear this on lazy mornings while cuddling my precious little girl. This is definitely going in the hospital bag! I would recommend this to any expecting mom. The whole set comes in a matching bag made of the same material as the pajama set.

I recommend buying the large if u want it to cover all of your pregnant belly. It covers but I can feel the wind because it does not lay flat over but still enough. My robe will not go over my belly but half way but everything is SUPER loose especially around the waist so I am very happy with that. There is plenty of room for the tatas and around the rib cage. These pajamas feels like a soft jersey knit and I feel good about myself if someone shows up unannounced.

But, the black nursing tank just fell apart immediately. The stitching around the mid-section, where you'd need it to hold up for nursing, just let go. It already fit a little big, so it wasn't that I was needing more room than possible. Also, one arm on the robe also has loose stitching where it just let go. So now, one arm hangs lower than the other and it bothers me. For the price, I'd expect better quality and really bummed. The tank will not work out for nursing as it just won't hold anything up.
The softest pijama ever!!! Love it !!!! And the print and color super nice and the baby's outfit super cute !

I am 5'7" and pre pregnancy size was a medium/34D.  Ordered this set as a medium and it fit great and I did not experience any issues as some others did with the top being too loose or exposing. There is zero support in the top however so I will likely wear a sleep nursing bra in addition to the top for support.
Comfortable, soft and attractive.

I'm 5'3" and the pants are just the right length, though I can see how they would be too short for anyone taller than me. The top isn't too low cut. I'm 35 weeks pregnant right now and the top just barely fits over my belly, but it's tight. It should be nice and comfy after I have the baby.

reviewText: My wife love it

Excellent! Used it during my last trimester, in the hospital and many months later when I was breastfeeding. Fabric is very soft and cooling. Has a nice relaxed fit and is not baggy.
Love this PJ set. It is much better than others I used w my first pregnancy.

What I love about this set is that once the baby is born and your belly is gone you can wear the pants and the "robe" with any other nursing tank or camisole you feel comfortable using at night during the nursing sessions.
It was hard for me to use the pink camisole in this set with the nursing pads once I started breastfeeding because it doesn't have a shelf bra to hold pads in place. So I started wearing other nursing camisoles with the set (the best feature about this set- mix & match).
You can use this set during the summer-without the robe or in the winter-with it. The robe is long and drapes beautifully below the butt.  The robe can be tied with a belt or attached ties. I just got rid of the belt after the baby was born, because I needed a quick access to the nursing cami at night, and I couldn't be bothered with all these belts. Attached ties were easier to use than the belt.
summary: Easy to use, many ways to wear, SUPER comfortable.

I don't know how they would have fit had I tried them while I was still pregnant but they are ideal as post partum pajamas. The only reason that I gave them 4 stars is because they were very pricey. I can't believe that I paid this much for pajamas but I attribute that to pregnancy madness. Oh well. I like them and they are comfortable and I suppose that is all that matters in the end.
The BEST pajamas. So so so worth the price. I tell all of my pregnant friends about them.

reviewText: i love the feel of this pajama set and actually like the gown that it comes with for the infant.  Great that it is open on the bottom making the 10-12 daily diaper changes within the first couple weeks easy.  The material is great and pretty forgiving.  Nice for visits when guests stop by.  My only issue with this pajama is with the top.  If you use this while breastfeeding and try to use it by pulling the cups down so that you can feed your baby, they get very stretched out and sag down afterward.  It would be better if there was a nursing flap of some sort to avoid that from happening and at the price point of this product, I would almost expect it.  You can get nursing pajama sets with the nursing clip down cups at the mall maternity stores for the same or lower cost.  The fabric isn't as comfy as these, but what good is it if the top is so stretched out that you don't want to wear it after a few uses?  Would imagine these would be great during pregnancy though.  I bought them for after the baby arrived.  I bought a small and it was a little big for me after two weeks post delivery.  I am 5' 2" and was 145 lbs two weeks post delivery and wearing a medium medela nursing/sleep bra.  Pre-pregnancy size small, if that is helpful for you in gauging the sizing.

Arrived promptly, fabric is soft and comfortable. Shirt is very loose and gapes a bit at the top but it's convenient for nursing. One of the belt loops was either broken on arrival or broke during the first wash. It's a cute set even if it's a bit pricey.

Perfect

reviewText: These are the best post-c-section pajamas! The waistband in the pants is very wide, soft, and stretchy. It has just enough hold to keep the pants up without putting any pressure on c-section incisions. I love it! Other reviewers have complained that the PJs aren't modest enough, but I haven't found that to be the case. I feel totally comfortable receiving visitors in them, especially if I'm wearing the robe. The fabric is very soft and cozy, and the tank top makes it very easy to nurse. Note that the robe is only a 3/4 length sleeve, so your forearms might get a bit cold at night. There are also no pockets, which would be a nice addition for holding things like a cell phone or tissues.
Nice and comfy, robe was a little on the small side. Every other piece fit great.

Love it. Very soft and comfortable. Somewhat low cut but the robe can help with coverage. Pants are slightly short but that works for me at 5'4.
LOVE.  Perfect for the hospital after birth and I had a CSection.  Soft and comfortable.  Pricey but you will use the set in the hospital and at home.
Totally worth the price. I'm in love!!
So soft and comfy!!!

FIRST, let me start by saying these are hands down the most comfortable pajamas I have ever owned/worn. They are soooo soft and cozy. I am 5' 7 and 140 lbs pre-pregnancy and the medium fit perfectly. The top is loose, but it has to be in order to be nursing friendly. I did not find the pants to be too short for me at all.

SECOND, let me tell you the reason they only got 4 stars.
I definitely debated on spending almost $100 on pajamas and decided to go for it. I plan to wear these in the hospital after I deliver my baby. I think they are worth the money, however they came to me with a huge hole in the side of the PJ bottoms. I have a sewing machine and sewed them right up, but for $100 there should be nothing wrong with them when they arrive.

Overall these were a good purchase, but beware that they might need some minor alterations/fixes before you ever wear them.
summary: let me start by saying these are hands down the most comfortable pajamas I have ever owned/worn

reviewText:
This just missed the 5-star boat by one problem.  It's too low-cut.

The set is soft, comfortable, high quality ... GREAT!  I bought this to have as a conservative pajama set to wear at the hospital amongst friends and family ... But it cuts lower than my actual nursing bra.  (My nursing bra looks like a cami underneath the top ... And my nursing bras aren't even that high.)
To make matters worse, the robe ties in a way where it won't allow the material to cross over in the front ... So I can't even manipulate that to cover my cleavage.

I'm not a big girl.

It's great ... But not public friendly for those not wanting to show the girls off.
I wish the pants were slightly longer - at 5'8 they're a bit short on me.
Love it - really beautiful.

The fabric is very soft but the sewing quality is mediocre. After the first wash on gentle, one of the belt loops tore (in hindsight, I should have taken the belt out first) and one of the small ties at the top of the robe began to unravel for no reason. I'm nervous to see what seam will come apart next. Not what I'd expect from an almost $100 set.

The fabric is great, but the fit is not. The top is a little large (but I'm not due for a few weeks, so it'll probably for better once I'm actually lactating) and the pants are ridiculously short. I'm about 5'9", and we're talking several inches too short. I'm disappointed, particularly given the price, but will keep them because everything else works. And, they are just for lounging. I did, however, order a pair of tall pajama pants elsewhere to go with the ensemble.

Pros:
Such a cute and comfy set! Super soft and baby gown is adorable!

Cons:
-Took forever to arrive (which is why I'm not returning it - baby will be here soon and I plan on wearing in hospital)
-Robe belt loop broke as soon as I tried it on
-Problems with white shirt
  It's huge (I bought my normal pre-pregnancy size, too), and I woke up literally hanging out of it!!
  It had a cig smell out of the pkg (eww!) but the other pieces did not...
  Totally see thru - if I'm lounging in this set when guests come over (it's cute enough for that), I'll have to wear a nursing bra or the robe.
summary: A little pricy for what you get

reviewText: I debated whether or not to buy these due to the high price. But I decided they were worth it based on the positive reviews. I like them - but there are some things I don't love. They are VERY soft and comfortable. BUT - I'm not tall (only 5'5") and the pants are a short. If I went up a size, the shirt would be huge. Additionally, the first time I wore the robe, the piece that holds up the tie broke. So while I love how comfortable these are and expect to really appreciate their softness after my C-section, I feel that for the price, they should hold up a bit better and I wish the pants were longer.
Amazingly soft and comfortable. Very pleased with this set. Note: the top is sort of thin, so doesn't offer a lot of coverage or support, but still, well worth the price.

reviewText:
I'm due in a few weeks and I wanted nice pj's for pictures in the hospital.  I ordered XL, I'm about 5'5 and 215, i *used* to wear a size 12, sometimes 14 for bust and these fit well.
These are so comfortable, I will probably live in them for the first few months at home.  Definitely pricey but I honestly haven't bought anything for myself in months so I splurged.  The matching baby outfit helped me to justify the purchase.

reviewText: Absolutely impressed!! It's a bit of a splurge but I'm so glad I bought this- the material is incredibly soft and it's just big enough that it's comfortable. I'm always concerned about what size to buy so I hope this helps someone: I'm 5'4" and at 6 months pregnant I'm about 165 lbs. I bought a size Large. The pants fit perfectly- even the length which surprised me. I will be wearing these for a while! The white top is just a little bit but again, incredibly comfortable and since I'll be getting bigger, I think it's perfect. The robe is perfect as well- not too snug on the arms, wraps fully around, etc. The matching baby sleeper is just too cute. I bought this set and a set from "Belabumbum" and this set is by far nicer. I want to buy another one!
Loved this set.  So soft. The nightgown was way too big for a newborn, but still cute to have the matching set. It was my favorite thing in my hospital bag.

reviewText: This is a very comfortable set and fits as expected!
AWESOME AWESOME .

I'm due with my 3rd baby next week and I've purchased A LOT of maternity and nursing items over the years.  I wish I had found these with my first - these are the MOST comfortable items for a changing pregnant body I've ever come across.  And, they don't make you look ridiculous. The material is soft and thin (but not see through) - which is great for summer months.  The quality is fantastic.  I will be wearing these for a long time - pregnant or not.
summary: ... set for my birthday - they are the most comfortable and best fitting pajamas that I have worn during ...

reviewText:
I splurged on this set since my regular PJs no longer fit (I'm 34 weeks) and I know I'm going to have a C-section and recovery, during which this will be nice to have.

I love how comfortable these are! The pants fit perfectly and have enough soft elastic to stay up on my belly. The shirt is soft and lightweight, and the robe is a great size and fit.

I do have some minor complaints. Being a nursing top, it is very loose, especially around my "girls" - when I lay on my side, one inevitably falls out! I already know I won't be able to breastfeed due to medical reasons, so I might just sew the top together where it overlaps, for more support. Also, the material is so thin that you can see right through it (I have the pink top).
I also wish that the pants had a drawstring in addition to the elastic. After the baby is born, it might be harder to keep them up without a drawstring, so I might end up adding one.

All in all I'm happy with this, but giving it 4 stars because a set this expensive shouldn't need me to make my own alterations to make it work!
summary: Comfy, fits well, but a few complaints

reviewText: BEYOND comfortable. These fit the bill perfectly as I was looking for postpartum PJs that would cover my belly and allow for easy nursing. These would make an excellent baby shower (or postpartum gift) to any new mom. The matching baby outfit was a plus and is adorable. I wish I could give half stars, as I would then give them 4.5 stars as the top is quite see through. However, other than that, I am quite in love with these PJs. I wish they came in more colors/patterns too...I might of bought another set!
summary: A postpartum treat I won't regret...Love them!

reviewText: Extremley comfortable, softest material ever.  Love it!

I am not one to just write a product review, however I was so pleased with these pajamas I feel I must... The cotton fabric is unbelievably soft, & the color is better than I expected... The waistband on the pant is perfect for during late pregnancy as well as after birth... I thought the baby gown in the same fabric was a nice bonus with this purchase... I am hot natured even when not pregnant so I love the sleeve, or lack of sleeves on the top, & having the lightweight robe for modesty when visitors come was a huge plus as it is not so heavy that it becomes stuffy... Initially I wasn't wild about spending so much on pajamas, but these are completely worth the expenditure & will likely purchase another set or the set with shorts as well...
summary: Perfect softness, perfect waistband, perfect fit!!!

reviewText: Not as soft as I thought they would be. The waterproof bibs are a bit flimsy and poor in quality. I'm glad I bought this on sale and did not pay full price for it! All the size runs small. My 2.5 month old can no longer fit in these 0-3 month onesies!
its not comfortable

I bought this on a special lightning deal as a gift for my sister in law.

The styles are cute and so versatile they work easily for both boys and girls!  I love the little ducky pattern, they are adorable.

All in all, a great deal and a very cute set that is extremely useful!

I ordered this for a just in case. When I received this and I had 2 more baby shower invitations- wish I had bought more of them. Nice colors. Gerber quality. Could be broken apart and used for several small gifts.

The mittens don't stay on that well and are thin, but they are functional to cover the newborn's nails so they don't scratch themselves. The burp cloths are a bit narrow and don't cover the shoulder too well. reviewText: Normally wear a size medium, ordered a large/extra large still fits quite tight but fits.

I needed some new fitness gear and really like bright colors so I was excited to get this top. It looked like it would provide pretty decent support and be comfortable during my workouts and yoga. The color is pretty accurate to the photo provided (I got green) and I used the size chart to determine what size to get, however, it was pretty tight and a struggle to get one. At the time I tried it on, I weighed 135 pounds with a 36" chest and I ordered an XL. I could barely get it over my chest. Once I was able to do so, it cling to me to the point where i'm not entirely sure it's going to be so comfortable during a workout. The material is a lot thicker than I expected; it's a thick spandex type material. There is a built in bra and since it's so tight, I was right about the support part. Unfortunately I don't have to option to reorder one size up because XL is the largest they make. If you are a small or medium, I would definitely go up one size just to be safe. Girls with larger breasts, don't even bother, to be honest. My chest isn't huge, but boy did I struggle!  I really love the top, just wish it fit better!
I received this at no cost or discounted, however all thoughs are strictly my own and were not influenced in any manner.

reviewText:
My main complaint is that the one I received reeked like cigarette smoke. I think someone must have returned it after smoking next to it. Gross! I don't want this on my baby. I'm sending it back myself.

It doesn't stay on his head very well, but I can't really imagine how they could design something better that wouldn't be a total strangulation hazard so I think it's okay for what it is.

The sizing is larger than I expected. My baby is 8 months old and in the 98th percentile head circumference so I worried it would be too small but it was actually a little loose even on the main setting.
I love this we have hard tile floors and every time he would get on them I would panic. Now I can let me run free!

It does look somewhat funny but it does the job ! Its been a week my 7.5 month old wore it and it saved her head many times or she would have bumped it on hardwood floor real bad . Im happy I got it .. she is pulling herself up and crawling and then sits and still looses balance and flips so this helmet is a lifesaver for me . She is my 4 child and none of my kids had this kind of a helmet before because there was no need , but she is tiny and still young and very adventurous so Im happy for this product . Her head does get sweaty where the padding is , but we take it off when Im next to her so she doesnt stay in it all day long so its not a big issue . I don't tie in under the chin though , just slip it on , adjust the Velcro and tie hanging straps up the padding behind her head .

In my house we have all wood floors, so my super active 10-month-old son was constantly bumping his little head on the floors. When I found this I knew I had to get it. (Even if that meant being judged by other parents). The second I put it on him and saw him crawling around the house, it gave me peace of mind knowing that if he fell, it wouldn't be such a bad hit to his head and I was glad that I didn't have to hover over him constantly whenever he was pulling himself up on the furniture. I also couldn't stop laughing when I put it on him!! (It's pretty goofy looking, but that's what makes it so cute! Lol) When I first put it on he wanted to take it right off (like he does with any hat I put on his head) but once he was crawling all around and pulling himself up, he forgot it was on his head. The only reason I'm rating 4 stars instead of 5 is because I'm not a huge fan of the string ties. When I tied them together under his chin he easily pulled the bow apart. I just ended up tying them together behind his head to keep them out of the way. It would probably be better if it was an adjustable buckle instead of just strings. But overall, besides that, it's great! It's super soft and size adjustable with velcro to fit all babies. Another nice thing is that the top isn't closed in completely, which allows baby's head to breathe. And it covers front and back of head as well as the sides. It's probably the closest thing we'll get to putting our babies in a bubble! Lol

If this review was helpful, please give it a thumbs up! :)

reviewText: Would buy again

You will 100% be teased. (You the parent, not the child.) Older, wiser grown ups will tell you "Oh, he'll fall a few times, and he'll learn!" Well, I got the model that doesn't learn, and my house is hardwood and stone flooring. "You'll use it for a week and forget about it!" False. I used this helmet every single day for a month and have zero regrets. In that awkward time between learning how to sit up and learning how to do anything else from that point, my kid just took every opportunity to tip over, often near a convenient coffee table. This helmet didn't stop him from getting upset about falls, but it genuinely did keep him from getting seriously injured or bruised, and it calmed my first-time-mom nerves. Given how much there is to worry about with these tiny humans, you might as well take the opportunity to worry a little less. I'm honestly really glad I got this. It's been under the bed since my baby figured out how to get from sitting to crawling, but it was worth it while it was needed. $15 well spent.

reviewText:
As previous reviewers have stated, this coat arrived smelling unpleasant.  BUT after washing and drying with dryer sheets, the smell was gone.  It is a huge bonus that this coat can be machine washed and dried at home instead of requiring dry cleaning.

The fit is a bit awkward.  The arm holes were sewn too much to the rear of the poncho.  Not a problem for wearability just a design flaw (and my personal opinion).

The button placement was awkward as well.  Too close to the edge so when buttoned up that the neck opening is HUGE.  I repositioned all of the buttons so that the collar closed more tightly to the neck.

Overall I am pleased with this purchase.  I am pregnant and in my third trimester during the coldest months of the year.  I needed a coat that would accommodate my belly but keep me warm.  I wish there were sleeves but I'll take what I can get:)  The price can't be beat and despite the fit problems this coat is very cute and so far has kept me pretty warm.
summary: Cute jacket but not without it's problems.

reviewText: is just bad period . fabric, the way its sowed wrong, no button whole . it feel cheap it looks cheap  !!!!

This coat is what led me to write reviews. For $16 one should not expect much, but I have never made an online purchase that was so deceptive or disappointing as this coat. You will smell this poncho before you see it. It bears a discomforting odor that led me to suspect that the item was used or previously stored in a kennel.

The buttons were crooked and 2 fell off once touched. The button holes were still stitched close, so a razor blade was necessary to cut them open. The hem was roughly sewn and loose threads were hanging off. A scissors was needed to trim them.  One sleeve is bigger and longer than the other. It may be required to surgically shorten your arms for a proper fit.

The most laughable part of this entire purchase is when you finally put on the poncho. It was lopsided, lean, crooked, ill-fitting and looked like it was made by a blind seamstress (or an overworked factory worker with impossible quotas to fill). It actually was quite funny and made me laugh. I understand with Allegras fashion it is a big gamble. Prices are cheap and sometimes you will get a good item. This was not such an occasion.
summary: Incredibly Ill-Fitting, Pungent Smell, Poor Workmanship

reviewText: It was amazing and sexy I loved it so did my bf

I received the Baggallini  Triple Zip Bag today and was very disappointed. I carry small bags but this one was too small for me. I also like to leave my bag open for easy access of cellphone, wallet etc. You can not do that with this bag. The way the strap is positioned causes the bag to tip sideways and is very awkward. The credit cards slots are too close to the bottom of bag and are useless because they are in the way. You would have to fight to get to them. No matter how I tried to arrange my items it just did not work, and the front snap compartment is too small to fit anything in it. Also it has no cellphone slot which I did realize this but I think if it had that instead of those credit card slots it would be better.  I did not care for this bag at all. Nice colors and workmanship but that doesn't do a person any good if the purse is awkward. I have already packed it back up and I am sending it back for a refund.

There are only six card slots in this wallet - way too few if one wants to carry credit cards, drivers license, business cards, library cards, membership cards, etc. In addition, the slots are at the bottom of the largest zippered compartment, where you're likely to put the most 'stuff' including a phone. Inevitably, the slots are blocked and it takes some digging to get to them.
summary: card slots are too few and poorly designed

reviewText: I should have double-checked this item on Amazon against the Baggalini website--the dimensions given on Amazon are WAY off.  I was looking for something that would carry my Kindle, wallet, keys, etc.  This purse is too small for anything except wallet and keys.  Certainly can't fit the Kindle or even a paperback in there.  I've kept it, because I can use it on days when I won't carry anything else exept wallet and keys, but those days are very few--maybe when I travel.
The size of this bag is said to be 20 X 5 X 14 and weight of 4 lbs.  The actual size of what I got is only 8-1/2 by 6 inches and that's pushing it.  Needless to say, it's going back asap!
The size info stated that the bag was 20X14 - it is clearly NOT that size. It's cute, but more like 4x6 rather than the size stated!

Dimentions of this bag were not correct.  Much smaller than anticipated but when I compared the dimentions with other Baggallinis, it appears the same dimentions have been used for ALL models.....looks like Amazon may need some updating

This bag was recommended by a friend - a friend to whom I will be forever grateful.  I purchased it from a store in Fort Lauderdale and paid considerably more than Amazon's price.  I travel internationally 11 months of the year this bag is perfect for travel.  It goes in my carry-on during travel keeping my travel documents, money and credit cards secure while traveling.  It then doubles as a great purse to use when I reach my destination and don't want to carry the large purse I use when travelling.  It is lightweight and very roomy.  Best purchase I've made in a long time. . .

I've never been a fan of large purses.  I've been searching for the perfect small purse for months and finally came upon this one online.  It's the perfect size and so surprisingly roomy.  My last purse only had a main compartment and a small one in front.  I love having the two separate bigger compartments.  I'm able to organize much better.  Love absolutely everything about this purse.
summary: Biggest little bag I've ever owned!

One more thing, the off parallel strap is a good idea, but it does not work for me. And, it does not hold the length position you place it in. Mine keeps moving longer without my adjusting it.  Wish they'd give us these options.

reviewText: Beautiful color! I love the different pockets. Love it!

This is a great little bag!  I ended up buying a 2nd one.  The first one I ordered was quickly confiscated by my daughter - she loves it!  She says it has a spot for all her things and everything is easy to access.  For me, it's a great bag to use on lighter days when I don't need to carry all my stuff.  I really like the zippered pockets, the size and efficient use of space.
This crossbody is on the small side and is very lightweight. It has lots of compartments & pockets. I love it!

My wife ordered this bag. She told me this new type of bag is too small. The older style bag was much better as far as size. She likes Baggallini bags, but the older style. This bag was returned. The older style was found on e-bay and purchased.
Oh wow I love this bag.  Small but everything fits.  I purchased another as a back up.  Love it
I have several in this model Baggalini bag in different colors and just love them.  This one is no exception.
summary: ... this model Baggalini bag in different colors and just love them. This one is no exception

reviewText: Perfect bag for someone who wants a small one.  Love not needing a wallet with this bag.
My perfect travel bag!!!
Perfect for all my necessities. Easy to find everything in separate compartments. Hands free cross body strap or attach to belt.
It ended up being too small for my needs but is a very nice bag.  Just need more space.  I carry too much crap
summary: ... too small for my needs but is a very nice bag. Just need more space

reviewText: My favorite purse ever! Also have one in a different color.
Great for small, lightweight bag for travel.
love this! great color for fall/winter. nice long strap. lots of zipper compartments. perfect!
The wife loved the bag! It replaced one which she had worked to death. Thank you.
Love it
It's perfect! I easily carry my billfold, my iPhone 6 Plus, and my Kindle Paper White along with a lipstick in this little bag.
I love it, just the right size.  Just ordered another Bagalinni a little bit larger in black, great quality.

This is a most amazing bag.
There is quite a bit of room inside. Fill it up and it still looks good!
One problem is the strap. It slides off the shoulder, or if worn cross body, slides up the neck and chokes me.
Perfect for traveling for daily use.  Fits nicely in my larger carry on bag

Just what I was looking for. Many pockets and is small enough to fit inside my larger bag that I take to work or
travel with. Pull it out of the larger one when I don't want to carry anything heavy. Always loved my leather
bags, but at times they are too heavy. This small baggallini also goes crossbody.

I love this purse.  Recently, I had a torn rotater cuff injury and found every purse I owned to be too painful to use and backpacks are out of the question!  My standard purses carry a lot of items I don't use or need on a daily basis and are best suited for travel.  I have tried all sorts of small bags and they are either too small or too big.  My sister carries a Triple Zip that I noticed on a recent visit.  We went to the fair and she carried the bag on a belt so her hands were free.  Other times she uses the cross-body strap.  I went right home and ordered one!

While this bag is quite petite, it carries my credit cards and checks, my cell phone (Samsung Note 5), diabetes test kit, car keys, several small pill bottles and a back-up battery for my phone.  Oh it also has a zipped change pocket and zip pocket on the back.  Carrying this little gem cross-body, there is no balance issue, back strain, shoulder strain or neck strain.  I am quite pleased with the size and the construction and will likely buy another in the future.
summary: A whole lot of a little purse.

reviewText: My fault I didn't read the description very well.  This is more like a wallet than a purse.
summary: This is more like a wallet than a purse

reviewText: Love it!
Loved it!  Loved it!  Thank you so much.

perfect for travel - so glad I got this - bought the mushroom color.  - light blue inside so you can find things. off shoulder or cross body  - perfect for going everywhere on a vacation where you want to be able to do things but still have "your stuff." Plenty of room for sunglasses, iPhone, hotel keys, car keys, lipstick, used the credit card slots- would definitely buy another one in a darker color for a winter trip.

Baggallini tends to change around their designs in small ways they really shouldn't. Like others, the placement of the steel loops for attaching the shoulder strap is highly annoying to me. On many Baggallinis, these rings are on the ends of the purse so the weight is evenly distributed. But on this model, the rings are placed on top, but on opposite sides of the zippers. So no matter which way you're zipping one of the three zippers, a strap is in the way! There was no reason to do this, and it doesn't work well. Avoid this design and try another.
summary: Alternating side purse strap is REALLY annoying

reviewText: This bag weighs 8 ounces empty. If it were lighter and had one or two less compartments, it'd be a keeper for me. Instead, I'm going with the Baggalilini Teenee.

I bought this to carry my phone (LG G2 - fits perfectly in front pocket), Kindle (paperwhite - fits perfectly into 2nd pocket), Camera & Wallet (fit perfectly in 3rd pocket) and Passport (fits perfectly in back pocket).  It has loops at the back so I can detach the strap, throw that in my backpack, and put this on the front with the waist band straps of my backpack through the loops.  Super easy while walking to have access to everything I need, and voila turns into a purse at night or on non walking days.

The only thing is it would be nice if the loops at the back were a tiny bit bigger as I have to remove the waist band clasp (we're talking 1mm at most here!) to attach the purse to my backpack, but that's pretty minor.

I don't use the credit card slots so no opinion on those.  Also I saw complaints about the zips being hard to open but I've not found that to be true at all.
summary: Fits everything I need and attaches to my backpack!

reviewText: I've had this bag for about a year now.  After I got use to which compartment I was going to store different items in, I starting liking it more.  It is very compact but surprisingly hold quite a bit.  It forces me to clean it out regularly to get rid of things I do or don't need.  With a larger bag, I just tend to leave things in it because there is room.  The one complaint I have is that the compartments that hold credit cards, drivers license, etc., are just too small.  It is nearly impossible to put these items back in their respective slots without a struggle.  If this design flaw can be corrected, I would give five stars.  As it is, I now have to purchase a separate "small" wallet in order to make it easier to get my cards in and out. Not sure if the other styles of bags have a similar problem.

I travel a lot and am always looking for the 'perfect travel purse'.  I'm happy to say I found it.  For me this three zip is perfect.  Plenty of room for cash(including coins), credit cards, I-Phone, 2 pair of glasses with a pocket to spare for my other odds and ends.  Baggallini has smaller bags but I need more room for my "necessities". I recommend this product.

I bought this bag for my mum who needs her handbag to be light and hang across the body as she uses crutches/ a walking frame. The big zip tags are great for her arthritic fingers, the bag has lots of little pockets to keep things separate, and it is wide enough to fit her glasses in. Really well designed bag - Mum loves it.

I bought this bag to take on an Alaskan cruise, thinking I would use it when I was out on excursions.  I ended up using it constantly, and forgoing my big, heavy purse.  I love wearing it cross-body style, which leaves my hands free and my shoulders unfettered.
Now that I have been home a week, I still haven't gone back to carrying my purse.  It is so easy to organize this bag.  In the small front zipped  section I keep my cash and coins.  In the next larger zipped section I keep my lipstick, sunglasses and keys.  In the big section I keep a pen, iPhone and misc. items.  In the small back pocket I keep my credit cards.  The large zip section has a place for credit cards, but it doesn't hold them well, so I am happier keeping them safely zipped in the back pocket.  I no longer carry a wallet, and I don't miss it!
I bought the charcoal color, as it is very neutral.  My 86 year old mother liked it so much, I got her a black one.
summary: No more heavy purses for me...

reviewText: Love this.  I got the charcoal.  The pink interior makes it a little more interesting, and makes finding items easier.  I love all the different compartments; all my things have their own place.  It's great for travel, great for around town.  The only annoying thing is the jangle of the zippers when I walk.  I use this almost exclusively these days.

I purchased this bag to replace a 30 year old leather bag that was my favorite. I don't like a big bag, I don't carry one unless it's necessary. This bag allows me to carry my essentials, with out being too bulky.

it's well made. It has lots of carrying options. it's exactly what I need.

I love this bag. I love all the compartments and size. It is
 the perfect little everyday bag for me.

I purchased this bag for a trip a few years ago and am extremely satisfied with it.  I wanted something lightweight that I could pack all my travel stuff into that would be versatile. I've now traveled all over the world with it. The bag is roomy while still being the size of a fanny pack.  It has several zippered compartments including an inside zippered pocket (for emergency cash stash.)  The bag holds my travel documentation (passport, tickets, etc.), money and credit cards, phone, pen and small travel journal, camera (Canon PowerShot A1100IS), small bottle of sunscreen and lip balm, and crushable hat -- all with room to spare!  One of the best features is the ability to convert the strap to be an over the shoulder, cross-body, or a waist bag (with either the native strap or using the belt loops with your own belt.)  It fits nicely into my larger carry-on bag.  This bag is truly one of the best purchases I've made for travel or otherwise.  I have the beige one and am buying another one in a different color.

I have a Baggallini Luggage Everywhere Bag with Exterior Pocket that I really like but I needed a smaller bag to use as a "to go" bag for taking my dog out. I wanted something stylish yet versatile to stash pick up bags, treats, my keys, a small flash light and so on when I walked my dog. This Triple Zip Bagg was perfect. The multiple compartments were just what I needed. Everything was organized and easy to get to. The length was very comfortable. The bag also held up well to a little abuse by the puppy. Muddy paw prints wiped off very easily! As time went on I found a curious thing happening. More and more I was using this bag when I was was running errands. I started to stash some money and a credit card in the bag and then would use it when I didn't want to carry my bigger Baggallini bag. The size was perfect for walking around the mall or grocery store. Finally I decided I should just break down and get another one rather than carrying around all my dog supplies all the time. I am looking forward to carrying it on an upcoming trip. It fits all of my basic essentials. The multiple zipper compartments will allow me to be organized and my things will be secure. The cross body styling will be easy to tolerate for hours on end. I highly recommend the Triple Zip Bagg!
summary: Liked it so much I just bought a second one!

reviewText:
Initial impressions:
I thought that front zipper pouch would be a wallet, but it's not.  The credit card slots are in the biggest zipper pocket, the one in the back.  There isn't what I would consider to be a currency section, and the bag is too small to put bills in unless you fold them.  The little magnet pocket in the front is too small to put much of anything in.

Having used it for a couple of weeks:
I do like it, and I'm keeping it.  I center a key ring over the magnet base in the little front pocket and then close the magnet through the ring itself.  The keys rest in the pocket and stay put really well.  The little zipper pocket behind the magnet pocket is my currency pouch - I fold bills once crosswise to get them in and drop change in the bottom.  That's working better than I thought it would.  Behind that is my smart phone in a roomy zipper pouch, and there's a zipper pocket in the wall of that pouch where I put my bigger key ring - the one with RFID tags, a flash drive, and keys.  The very back zipper pouch is where I put my credit cards, my sunglasses, and my Altoids box, with loops at the top, one of which has my lip balm and other has my pen.  In the back outside wall is another zipper pocket, flat, and that's where I put my transit pass.  I don't ordinarily carry my Kindle, but I tried it in the biggest zipper pocket, and it does fit very nicely.

My smart phone would fit really well in the back wall flat zipper pocket where I have my transit pass, but I like the transit pass there.

Pluses:  This handbag is seriously cute.  It's way smaller than I expected, but that's great, I wanted small.  Having a place for everything makes finding any one thing so much easier.  I got the mushroom color, and it's very pretty - darker than the picture seems - with a pretty light blue lining.  It's easy to see everything that's inside.  The quality appears to be really good, too.  The strap adjusts from what I would consider to be a very short shoulder strap length to very long, and you can easily remove it completely.  You can thread a belt through it and wear it as a waist pack.

I went from disappointed and unsure I would keep it to actually quite pleased with it.  Give it a chance.

Update:
I tried the Wallet Bagg after buying this one, and it was too big.  I went back to this one, and I'm buying two more, charcoal and pewter.  I wish it came in some of the fun prints.  Whatever, this is my purse from now on.  There's more room than the smart phone needs in the front zipper pocket, so I laid my big key ring in the bottom of the pouch and dropped the smart phone in on top of  it.  If I decide to upsize when I get a new phone, I'll still have lots of room.  I keep my RFID key fobs in the zipped wall pouch behind the smart phone so they don't fall out, and when I want to use one I just pass the purse near the sensor and I'm in without taking the key fob out or even opening the purse.

My husband has the Kindle Touch and I have the cheapo Kindle with ads on it, and either one will fit in either of the two larger pockets, as unlikely as that seems.

I love this purse.  I can find anything I want in it instantly, it weighs nothing, and it's darling.

I bought this bag because I needed something lightweight, but roomy
after pulling my shoulder more than once carrying large bags.
This little bag goes the distance in that regard.  It is small, but holds alot.
The two issues which prevented me from giving it 5 stars are a)the strap
slider does not stay put when adjusted and b) the "jingle bell" factor.
Baggallini uses so many heavy zipper pulls on their bags that they sound
like jingle bells when carrying the bag. I use this bag for church and the
 noise factor is a real consideration. I also just find it annoying.
I'd like to purchase another one, but this factor holds me back.

After my old Baggalini finally croaked after YEARS of use, I looked for a long time for a small bag with the right configuration that could hold the things I need. This is just the right size. A little larger than a wallet, but you can take the strap off and fit it into a larger bag if you want a fashion change. It has enough room to hold cards,cash, phone, keys, essential makeup, notepad, reading glasses, etc., and still room to stuff in odds and ends when needed.

I consider it like a large wallet on a strap. I bought this in charcoal, which has a hot pink interior. I would definitely get this again, or buy more in other colors.

I thought I had found the perfect bag for hands free shopping and travelling.  It is the perfect size and shape, and has plenty of pockets. However, after wearing it for just one day, the material on the strap rubbed my neck until my skin was red and scratched, and I had to stop wearing the bag. I'm hoping I can come up with a good idea for a new strap that coordinates in some way, because I really liked this little bag otherwise.
summary: The material rubs my neck raw.

reviewText:
I would actually rate it a 4.5
The pros:
It has 6 pockets, 5 of them usable.  The secret pocket in the back holds my passport.  The next pocket is just right for my Kindle Touch with lighted cover and two pens. (It has nice little pen holders there).  The pocket in front of that perfectly fits my wallet, pack of tissues, iPhone (that's in an Otterbox Reflex case) and iPhone cords. There's an inner, zipped pocket that holds thumb drive and keys. The pocket in front of that holds my odds and ends.  Who would think that such a small bag could hold so much.  It's practically the TARDIS.

The belt loops in the back of the bag that make it convertible to a waist-pack are big enough that just about any belt can be used.

The cons:
Although it can be used as a waist-pack in a pinch, it's rather clumsy for that purpose.  It pulls away from your body.  The shoulder strap is meant to be convertible for the waist-pack but doesn't feel secure and it has to be adjusted.  I purchased a webbing belt to use when I wear the bag at my waist.

The little front snap pocket is practically useless.

The fabric does not seem very sturdy.  I expect it to fall apart in about a year, at which point I hope this exact Baggallini is still available.

Update
It's February 2013 and I still love this bag.  I have since bought a very professional-looking, designer bag but I rarely use it.  I prefer the Baggallini.
summary: It Fits !!!  An almost perfect travel bag

reviewText: I have arthritis in my shoulders, I needed a bag that's not too heavy & a cross body style.  This bag is great. It holds more then I expected  and does not bother my shoulders. I will be getting more in different colors ! Love it!!!!

I prefer very lighweight handbags.  I have several inexpensive nylon handbags and wanted a better quality one.  The triple zip bag is quality made.  All the seams are smooth and the nylon zippers are smooth and easy to open and close.  The bag is just a little too small for me to use everyday. The strap can be removed and slipped in to the tabs on the back to wear it as fanny pack.  It was a great price on Amazon so I will keep it and use it for travel or I might use it to carry around my knitting supplies.
summary: Well designed for travel; a little small for everyday

reviewText:
i am buying my second triple zip bagg. this is my every day purse.

to give an idea what it can hold:

-i use the front (smallest zip compartment) for a coin purse and pack of gum.

-my multiple lip balms store easily reachable in a little zippered pockett in the front big compartment.  in the main part of that compartment, i keep my camera, travel size sunscreen, and a small pouch/wallet of misc items.

-in the largest (back) zip compartment i have my "wallet" (a 3"x4" fairly flat zipper pouch) of credit cards/cash, a small notebook, and a travel pack of tissues.  i do not use the credit card slots that are built in (agreed with other reviewers they are flimsy and take a little extra time to manipulate).

-i attach my keys by their key ring to the outside front strap clip, where they are easily reachable without even looking.

-i slip my cell phone into the wee back zipper pocket and generally leave it unzipped for easy access. if bulky items go in here, they feel uncomfortable against my leg, but a smooth flat cell phone works perfectly.

with a slight bit of rearranging, i can fit my kindle touch in its leather case in the back compartment to bring along my day's entertainment.  but most print books will not fit.

after over a year of daily use, i did develop problems with the metal connectors between the strap and the clip (where the clip top peg fits in to swivel/spin-around hole) detaching from each other.  i have often fit them back together, but they inevitably pop back out again. as a temporary fix, you can use the clip to grab both the d-ring on the purse where it normally attaches, and the ring on the strap - the only downside is that it then cannot swivel and the straps get twisty.

my only aesthetic comment is that the colors (at least the blues and greens) are dull or watered down. i guess that makes them more neutral? they are not vibrant, more like "powdered" versions of colors.

I purchased the Baggallini Triple Zip Bagg in Graphite after I returned the Baggallini Teeny Bagg which turned out to be just a little too teeny.  The Triple Zip is the perfect size for me.  I use it as a small bag when I just run errands.  It's large enough to fit all your wallet items, plus keys, cell phone, IPod and glasses with room to spare.  The strap is adjustable so you can use it cross body purse or make it small so you can wear it around your waist (my preference when I walk or run).  If I need to carry more things, I throw the Baggallini Triple Zip into a large bag or a tote and it will simply serve as a wallet.  I will be purchasing another one in a lighter color for the summer months.
I purchased this in Navy Blue. What an awesome little purse that holds a lot. I have absolutely no negatives to report here. I love it!! Well made and durable.

I was afraid this would be too small, but I am very happy with this bag.  It fits everything that I need, and because it is so light, it doesn't bother my shoulder or neck. I will consider purchasing another one in a different color soon.

However, since I had 7 days to try them out, I wore them around the house and after about an hour, they felt just right, no longer squeezing my foot.  I think they'll break in even more after a few weeks and be just perfect.  These are very comfortable and I think they'll be great for long hours on my feet.  I think Prime Wardrobe is a great option for trying shoes since it's so hard to order online.

Skechers work shoes are great!!.... i wear them 5 days a week and they hold up nicely considering environment and hard use.... i replace my shoes about once a year whether i need to or not... i do find a little bit of wear and they begin to split after about a year.. but when considering 40 hours a week in a kitchen environment, i would say they hold up fabulously!!! i never have to worry about putting them on and wearing them from the first day.. no break in period.... i would say... don't be chincy... cheap begets cheap... and your feet will suffer... get the better shoes... the memory foam insole holds up fantastically and never fell apart.... Skechers do typically run a little small so order a half size up and you won't be disappointed...

If you have any sort of foot issues skechers are not for you!  I have posterior tibula tendinitis and ordered these shoes for work.  Too small, too narrow and not enough sole for cushion.  Not worth the $$$ spend the extra $ and get a GOOD shoe like Brooks, Asics, etc.....

reviewText: These are good shoes. I normally wear an 8 1/2 in Skechers, but I listened to the other reviews and ordered a 9. They are probably 1/4 size too big, but they fit comfortably. These shoes actually are memory foam, more of a gel insole, rather than the flimsy "memory foam" on other cheaper Skechers options. I recently ordered a $40 pair from Amazon and returned them because the "memory foam" was so thin. I work 8-10 hour days serving on my feet, and at the end of the day, my feet are slightly sore, but I expect that. These shoes definitely help. They are worth the extra money, rather than wasting your time with some cheaper option. I'd recommend them.

I wear compression socks with them. The back of my feet no longer hurt at the end of the day. However my toes are squished, rubbing, and in pain. If you have wide feet this is not the shoe for you. If you don't have wide feet it will probably work well for you.

reviewText: Absolutely love these work shoes, cute and comfortable!

I love Sketchers Air shoes but needed something that would last longer for work. These shoes are comfortable for the long hours I am on my feet. Only problem I'm having is the seam is tearing/thread coming apart right below where your toes are located. I've had them since last December, not sure how long shoes are supposed to last.

I wanted to like these shoes, I really did.  Initially, they were very comfortable and felt like they would be perfect to walk around in for hours.  As a waitress, I am on my feet anywhere from 7 - 14 hours at a time.  So shoes are important.  I currently wear an old pair of New Balance minimus shoes that are my favorite to work out in.  I bought a newer pair of those same shoes and downgraded the old ones to my work pair.  That pair is now like 5 or 6 years old, the tread has worn off and there is pretty much zero support, and they felt about the same as these shoes at the end of my shift.  There was one difference, and that was that these were clunky and the sole was thick and annoying to run around in.

Basically, don't waste your money.  If you are looking for a good work shoe as someone who works in the food industry, just pick a pair of good trainers or running shoes and wear them instead.  I eventually just bought a pair of Croc's for $30 and they work much better (despite being ugly).
summary: Clunky and Uncomfortable after a few hours

reviewText: I love it so much. It's a little warm right now but I know it will be great in the winter months!

Ok. So first off I ordered the carrot in an M and didn't believe it would fit or arrive in time but it did. I took a gamble bc of the other reviews saying it arrived quickly and I'm so glad it did. I read the reviews talking about height but none that mentioned peoples actually clothing sizes. So let me be honest with you so hopefully others with my same questions will order it. I am 5ft 3.5inches, the legs are still baggy, and fit all the way to my ankles and wrists as shown by the model. The crotch still hangs to about my knees, and the chest buttons fine. The boob area does not hang as much as on the model but I expected that. So if your a plus size girl don't worry this really does fit everyone.

Eh, I knew the fabric quality wouldn't be amazing when I first ordered it, but this onesie had a thin layer of blizzard fleece as opposed to the fluffier fabric most companies offer for the same price. This onesie is also a little to small for me, but i guess i should have paid extra for a size up instead of risking it. The shipping was much faster than I expected though- it came a few weeks before the earliest estimated day with the standard shipping. It did come with free socks, which was generous of the seller, but they didn't fit me due to my huge feet (that didn't affect my rating though). Overall, this onesie pretty much met my expectations. It will be fun for pictures and parties, but probably won't be my first choice for picking out a warm, comfy onesie for around the house.

reviewText: Sucks

I selected "fits somewhat large" - I was hesitant to buy the size I did (the 30" size) because I thought it would end up too small for me but surprisingly & happily it fits perfect! My waist measures 36", hips are 42", size 14. I am using it for postpartum support, shaping, & weight loss, (6 weeks postpartum), however - it laces pretty close on me with not much more room to tighten the laces when my waist/hips get smaller. The length is perfect for me, but I do have a long torso (5'5" frame). The quality is excellent but I do notice the front closure doesn't stay latched well - until it's on all the way, fully laced. I was not able to unlatch it & put it on around me, nor step into it, I was able to pull it over my head though (45" chest). I love the smooth shape it gives me, feels good on - keeps my posture in check, haven't had any discomfort when sitting in it, strong boning that doesn't bend or fold when you sit or bend - keeps you solid, it does lift my chest quite a bit which my husband thinks is the greatest thing ever. I am very happy with this corset, great quality & price!

reviewText: This is exactly what I was looking for! I wanted a longer corset than the usual size because I want to keep my belly fat enclosed, not pushed down to come out of the bottom of the corset like a shorter one would cause. It's a little awkward to sit in since it comes so far down it pushes on my thighs, but you have to expect that if you go with a longer corset. I would have preferred satin type or brocade material over the denim that this one is. but I knew what I was getting when I saw the pictures, there's just no satin in the long line style. It is as comfortable, at least as comfort goes with corsets lol! I can wear it and still breathe just fine, but it does hinder movement, definitely improves posture. I am 5'4" and 150 lbs, my waist is 31 1/2 inches and I got the size Medium, I have to pull the strings out almost all the way to get it on, but then tightening it is a pretty simple process, I can do it by myself without any help as long as I don't want it super duper tight. So overall I'm very happy with my purchase!

This corset fits a little strange. I have a very defined natural hourglass, but I'm a bit bigger than I like, and I was hoping to achieve a more dramatic hourglass shape than I already have. My waist is 32", so I got the Large, and I couldn't get it on without unlacing the string, and lacing the string while I was wearing it would have been very difficult, so I figured it was too small and sent it back, and ordered an XL. I can get the XL on, but at the tightest I could get it, it was tight around the waist, but so lose around the rib cage (upper part of the corset) that I could fit my entire arm in there!

I had my husband help me lace it up as tight as he could, and it was still loose enough around the upper part that I could still, with some difficulty, get my arm in there. Corsets are supposed to fight very tightly, so this was disappointing. Part of the appeal of wearing a corset, for me, is the dramatic way my bust stands out over the top of it, and with how lose the top of this corset was, my DDD bust looked like a late-blooming middle schoolers'. That was with it laced so tightly that I was having acid reflux, so I don't think the issue is the size of the corset, because when it's laced that tightly I'd expect it to be at least snug everywhere.

I'm giving it two stars because it has great material and seems like it would be very durable. You would think, though, that someone who already has a very defined waist would not have this problem with it, so I'm not really sure whether I should keep it and train with it, or return it again.

reviewText: I had been looking to purchase a corset for awhile. Theirs is very well made and a great price. Their team goes above and beyond expected in helpfulness.

This is actually a great starter corset for the price! I'm a regular corset wearer, so I knew how to counteract some of the issues that cropped up in the reviews, but I think this will be my go-to for daily wear now. The laces could stand to be a little longer, because it does run a little small. I can't get it up over my hips when closed and fully expanded, even though it should be the right size for my waist (I have to clip it around myself, which is a little time consuming, but possible). What I really loved is that it came pre-laced (CORRECTLY!); that is huge. Most mass produced corsets have to be laced when you get them, and almost no one does it right. It's stiff enough to reduce my waist several inches, but flexible enough to wear comfortably all day. I did not experience any of the issues with slippage with sitting that others reported; my guess is that they are not tightening it enough or wearing it in the right place. I wear a thin cotton tank top under it, too, which helps it (a) stay where it's supposed to; (b) keep it from digging into my skin when tightened and (c) stay clean longer--the fabric isn't very breathable, and would probably be a sweaty mess if you wear it with skin contact.

Overall, I'm really happy with it--really can't beat the value! And yes, it is real steel: the front has two solid rods that act as a sort of busk, and additional spiral steel. It doesn't have as many as some of the pricier corsets, and some appear to be spiral for flexibility, but for $30 I really can't complain. I would say the only way you wouldn't be happy with this is if you're wearing it wrong, or you're a serious veteran corset wearer and used to really rigid, solid bone construction.

Firstly, I'm quite satisfied that it came earlier than predicted! Fairly fast shipping for a product hailing from China. Now onto my little review.

At a glance, this big heart of blue captures the eye with its golden gleam and deeply shimmering azure stone of glass.
For my case, I came across a couple of minor issues; however they do not take away from the general wonderfulness of this product.

Within a few hours of first wearing it, the clasp's spring mechanism failed and broke, leaving me to remove it and connect the two rings together. Thankfully, the chain it comes with is quite easy to fit over the head, so the loss of the clasp was nothing mortifying.
Secondly, the frame itself seems a tad bent at the top of the heart, as if someone purposefully tried prying it off. The pretty glass gem inside mine in particular is certainly too small for the frame; although it matches in shape. However, I noticed that there is a small loop at the bottom of the heart, of which I used to wrap string through to keep the gem stable. Nonetheless, it still shakes around side to side, generating a fair amount of noise and concern over the glass. Glue in the edges of the frame should solve that issue, should any of you come across a similar case. I chose to be lazy and leave it be with the string --for now anyway.

Now back to the frame of the charm.
I've been wearing it steadily for a few days, perhaps even a week, and I've noticed signs of tarnishing in the 'gold' finish, most likely due to skin oil. Perhaps a frequent wipe-off or rinse will fix this, but I am unsure. I'm still experimenting upon the posting of this review.

Despite my little issues, I am satisfied with this product, especially for something with such a small price. Quality is fair, and only has small issues that are easily walked around. I'd say that these are a hit and miss with quality, and I happened to be in the middle ground with mine.
This necklace is overall a neat gift for Zelda fans, and I would recommend taking the gamble to grab yourself a neat heart container!

-TW

reviewText:
I ordered the Amoretu Women's Elegant Lace-trim Slip Adjustable Straps Bodycon Chemise Lingerie in Blue. There was only a one-size-fits-all option. My slip arrived promptly and was in excellent condition and looked to be of surprisingly high quality considering it was less than $20. The color was very close to what was pictured on my monitor although somewhat brighter. It was still absolutely gorgeous and the fabric was very comfortable. I am someone who is a bit particular and sensitive as far as fabrics go, so I would have been disappointed if it were scratchy or cheap feeling. I have felt finer fabrics, but again, this garment is less than $20, so I'm not expecting the finest chiffon or silk. I'm happy with polyester/spandex.

The fit is fabulous for the most part except for the chest. I loved the way it hugged my hips and waist and skimmed my stomach. I wasn't surprised that it was too small in the chest as I wear a 34E - 34F bra. However, I have tried on other lingerie similar to this which has been too small in the chest and it has still been flattering everywhere. The difference seems to be how the slip is cut/sized at the underwire portion of the garment, but I'm not positive. It just didn't sit flat against my body so the underwire was partially up my breasts and just not as flattering as it could be. I actually just looked more closely at the product photos while writing this review and it appears as though the exact same condition is happening on the model as well.  If it's of any help to anybody, my measurements are 38 chest, 30 waist, 38 hips. I normally wear a US Size 8 in clothing. I'm 5-8" tall and weigh 145 pounds.

I am 5'4, 120lbs and a 36DD. This is a very stretchy fabric with underwire in the bust. For those of us with larger chest area, underwire is hit or miss with s,m,l sized items. I ordered a small and while it fit perfectly on the bottom, it was slightly small in the bust. I could have ordered up a size and been ok with it.

The color is more of a darker royal blue and not as navy as the photo, but is still beautiful. The blue fabric is not at all see through. The lace on the cups and hem is seen on beautifully. It comes with a g-string in the blue. The straps are adjustable.

My fianc loves it!

I guess you would need to be C+ cup to make it work and fill it out. Also it was tight (I wear XS-S normally and this was super fitted and short). Unless you have the body of VS model with huge boobs and tiny waist, I would steer clear.

It is lightweight, comfortable, and looks great.  I was pleased to learn that titanium can be engraved, as I took the ring to a local jeweler, and had an inscription put on the inside of the band for a small fee.  This is the second ring I ordered.  I had to return the first one because I ordered a half-size too big.  However, the return was prepaid, and it was an almost effortless process to return it and re-order the proper size.  Overall, purchasing this ring was a good experience, and I am very satisfied.

reviewText: I Love my new wallet. It will hold whatever I want. I'm so happy I got it!

I've only been using this wallet for a few days, so maybe with time the stitching could come apart inside, but that could happen with any wallet. After reading some 1-star reviews, I took mine out to check over the strength of the stitching and overall quality, and I must say mine is a very well made wallet and I love it. And I am not one who is hesitant to toss a cheaply sewn wallet because it looks hideous. I'm not sure if the two clasps are meant to click together, but mine doesn't. However, the wallet stays together because of the hinges on the side. I put change/money in one of the clasp compartments, and my extra cards/coupons/stamps in the other. The slots are not as tight in some wallets, so I was able to fit several cards that I use more often in one slot. I have stuck my phone in the large side pocket and it is so roomy I could put just about anything I'd need in it to run into a store or take into a restaurant and set on the table near me. Am very satisfied with this purchase!
